Es madre de un hijo el cual ha beneficiado brindÃ¡ndole los estudios para su desarrollo siendo su mayor anhelo que su hijo llegue a ser un gran profesional. Su negocio se ha venido desarrollando poco a poco y esto gracias al apoyo de Ceprodel el cual le ha permitido la compra de sus productos para su respectiva comercializaciÃ³n y hoy en dÃ­a una vez mÃ¡s espera que su crÃ©dito sea otorgado para que de esta manera continÃºe con el desarrollo familiar y del negocio.
texts.en:
MarÃ­a Antonia R. is from the municipality of Telica in the city of LeÃ³n , where she has her own general store, which she opened 15 years ago with few economic resources and making few sales. She is the mother of one child, who she has helped with his studies, for his development. It is her greatest longing that her son becomes a professional. Her business has been developing little by little, and this is thanks to the support of Ceprodel, which has permitted her to buy the products that she sells. Today once more she hopes that a loan will be granted so she can continue in this way with the development of her family and the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Alicia es socia del Banco comunal â€œEspÃ­ritu Santoâ€ del Centro poblado D. Chimbo del distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 40 aÃ±os D. edad y es madre D. 6 hijos, 2 mayores con familias y 4 que aun dependen D. ella, no hizo estudios secundarios porque era huÃ©rfana, es casada, su esposo trabaja ayudÃ¡ndola en el negocio D. compra y venta D. ganado vacuno para engorD., antes D. iniciar con este negocio tenia una pequeÃ±a tienda D. abarrotes, hace 2 aÃ±os que incursiona en la crianza D. animales y al que actualmente se dedica. Con el primer prÃ©stamo D. S/: 300.00 nuevos soles compro 01 vaca para engorD..
Con el prÃ©stamo D. S/: 3000.00 nuevos soles que solicitara y que pagara en 5 cuotas comprara forraje, gallinazo, afrecho, etc.
Ella desea continuar con su negocio para tener mÃ¡s ganancias.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Community bank "Espiritu Santo" (meaning Holy Spirit) of the Centro Poblado D. Chimbo located in the district and province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 40 years old and she is mother of 6 children. Two are grown and have families of their own and the other four still deped on her. She did not have any secondary education because she was an orphan. She is married and her husband helps her with the business of buying and selling cattle. Before she started this business she had a small convenience store. For the past 2 years she has been raising cattle, a business she still carries out. With ther first loan of S/.300 neuvos soles she purchased one cow.

With this loan, amounting to S/.3000 and which will be repaid in 5 months, she will purchase hay, grain, bran cereal, etc.

She wishes to keep up her business to have better earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase feed for cattle (hay, grain, bran cereal).

loan.name: Agripina

texts.es:
DoÃ±a Agripina es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal â€œEspÃ­ritu Santoâ€ del Centro Poblado D. Chimbo, del Distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 64 aÃ±os y es madre D. 6 hijos que ya estÃ¡n casados (viven en Lima)estudio el segundo grado D. primaria. Ella junto a su esposo se dedican al negocio D. venta D. ropa americana desD. hace muchos aÃ±os, nos cuenta que con este trabajo hizo estudiar a todos sus hijo. Con el primer prÃ©stamo D. S/: 300.00 nuevos soles que recibiÃ³ D. Manuela Ramos compro fardos D. ropa americana para vender los dÃ­as Jueves en el Barrio Bellavista D. Puno, negocio con el continua trabajando para cumplir con su pago puntualmente.
Con el prÃ©stamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles que serÃ¡ pagado en 5 cuotas, comprara ropa americana para aumentar su mercaderÃ­a.
Ella desea continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Agripina is one of the founding members of the â€˜EspÃ­ritu Santoâ€™ Communal Bank in Chimbo, in the district and province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 64 years old and is the mother of 6 children, all of them married (and living in Lima); as a child she was in school through the second graD. of primary school. Agripina, together with her husband, has worked selling American clothing for many years now. She tells us that by doing this work she was able to put all of her children through school. Agripina used the first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles ($100) that she received from Kiva Partner Manuela Ramos to purchase bundles of American clothing, which she sold on Thursdays in the city of Punoâ€™s Bellavista neighborhood. She has continued to work in this business in order to complete her payments on time. Agripina will use the current loan of 3000 Peruvian Soles ($975) to purchase more American clothing so that she can increase her merchandise; the loan is to be repaid in five installments. Agripina hopes to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchasing American clothing wholesale

loan.name: Yesenia AsunciÃ³n

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Yesenia pertenece al Banco Comunal â€œInmaculada ConcepciÃ³nâ€ del Distrito de J., Provincia de Chucuito-Puno, vive en el Jr. San Juan NÂº 146 y tiene 31 aÃ±os de edad, es conviviente y madre de una niÃ±a de 8 aÃ±os, termino sus estudios superiores y se dedica a todo tipo de negocios segÃºn la temporada de venta. Su esposo se dedica al manejo de carros â€œchoferâ€. Con el primer prÃ©stamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro artÃ­culos de joyerÃ­a como artes, collares y pulseras, despuÃ©s de 2 aÃ±os cambio de rubro y abriÃ³ una Tienda .Ella es independiente en sus negocios, es muy activa en el trabajo, actualmente cuenta con tiendita escolar en el Centro Educativo NÂº 890 de J. que abre a partir de las 9 de la maÃ±ana y por las tardes sigue vendiendo en su Tienda de Abarrotes.
Con este prÃ©stamo que recibirÃ¡ de S/: 3000.00 nuevos soles el cual serÃ¡ pagado en 4 cuotas comprara material (cinta cola de rata) para confeccionar carteras, correas, etc.
Su deseo es construir su casa e implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yesenia belongs to the communal bank "Immaculate Conception" in the J. district in Chucuito-Puno province (Peru). She lives in Junior San Juan No. 146 and is 31 years old. Mrs. Yesenia lives with her partner, and has an 8 year old daughter. She finished her higher education and works in various types of businesses depending on the season. Her husband is a chauffeur.

With her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles (US $100), Yesenia bought artistic jewelry, necklaces, and bracelets. After 2 years, she changed directions and opened a shop. She is independent in her business and very active at work. Currently, she has a school shop in the Educational Center No. 890 in J., which opens at 9am. In the afternoons, Yesenia continues to work in her grocery store.

Yesenia is requesting a loan of 3000 Peruvian Soles (US $975), which will be used to buy material (ribbon) to make wallets, belts, and so on. The loan will be repaid in 4 installments. Her desire is to build her house and improve her store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy materials to make crafts (i.e. wallets, belts)

loan.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Sabina es nueva integrante del Banco Comunal â€œEspÃ­ritu Santoâ€ del Centro Poblado de Chimbo, del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo â€“Puno. Tiene 34 aÃ±os y es madre de 3 hijos pequeÃ±os aun, es casada, su esposo trabaja junto con ella en la crianza de animales menores. Ella nos cuenta que no pudo estudiar por que sus padres decÃ­an que las mujeres debÃ­an dedicarse a los cuidados de la casa.
Con el primer prÃ©stamo que recibirÃ¡ de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual serÃ¡ pagado en 5 cuotas comprara ganado ovino y porcino para engorde.
Su deseo es comprar mas ganado y asÃ­ continuar con la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sabina is a new member of the communal bank "Holy Spirit" of the Town Center of Chimbo, in the Yunguyo-Puno province of Peru. She is 34 years old, and married with 3 small children. Sabina's husband works with her to raise small animals.

She says that she was unable to study because her parents believed that women should dedicate themselves to household chores and duties.

With this first loan request of 500 Peruvian Soles (US $175), Sabina will buy sheep and pigs to fatten. She will repay the loan in 5 installments.

Her wish is to buy more livestock and continue to raise animals.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy sheep and pigs to fatten.

loan.name: Bruna

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Bruna es socia del Banco Comunal â€œInmaculada ConcepciÃ³nâ€ hace 9 aÃ±os , vive en el Jr. Daniel Espezua Velasco NÂº 451 del Distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito- Puno. Tiene 41 aÃ±os, es separada y madre de 5 hijos que apoya en sus estudios. Bruna con el primer prÃ©stamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro materiales para trabajar con bordados en bayeta. Ella empezÃ³ con este negocio cuando se separo de su esposo, tuvo que trabajar duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos y con el apoyo del Banco construyo su casa.
Actualmente vende los trabajos que realiza en Los Uros y cuando no le alcanza el tiempo compra bordados hechos de otras personas para no perder a sus clientes.
Con el prÃ©stamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara mas material para bordados como lana de diferentes colores, bayeta, etc.
texts.en:
Ms Bruna has been a member of the Banco Comunal â€œInmaculada ConcepciÃ³nâ€ for the past 9 years. She lives at NÂº 451 Jr. Daniel Espezua Velasco in the district of Juli, in the province of Chucuito-Puno. She is 41 years old, separated, and the mother of 5 children whose schooling she pays for. With her first loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles ($100.00 USD), Bruna increased her working capital and bought materials for embroidery. She started this business when she separated from her husband, as she had to work hard in order to raise her children and with the help of Banco Comunal she built her home. She currently sells the finished embroideries in Los Uros and when time is short, she buys embroideries made by others in order to not lose customers. With this loan of S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles ($500.00 USD) which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy more material for embroidering such as wool of different colours, embroidery fabric, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy wool and embroidery fabric

loan.name: Biviana

texts.es:
DoÃ±a Biviana pertenece al Banco Comunal â€œEspÃ­ritu Santoâ€ del centro poblado D. Chimbo del distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo- Puno. Tiene 64 aÃ±os D. edad, asistiÃ³ al Programa D. AlfabetizaciÃ³n durante 01 aÃ±o, es casada y madre D. 5 hijos. Biviana vive con una D. sus nietas quien siempre la acompaÃ±a. Trabaja aproximadamente 7 aÃ±os con el Banco. Con el primer prÃ©stamo recibido D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles decidiÃ³ invertir en la crianza D. animales menores como ovejas, chanchitos, negocio que inicio cuando entro al Banco y en el que trabaja junto a su esposo.
Con el ultimo prÃ©stamo que recibirÃ¡ D. S/: 2500.00 nuevos soles el cual serÃ¡ pagado en 5 cuotas comprara 01 vaca y forraje para engorD..
Su deseo es mejorar sus ganancias y asÃ­ incrementar su capital.
texts.en:
Ms Biviana belongs to the community bank "EspÃ­ritu Santo" of Chimbo in the district and province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 64 years old and attended the Literacy Program for a year. She is married and the mother of 5 children. Biviana lives with one of her granddaughters, who is always by her siD.. She has been a member of the community bank for approximately 7 years. She decided to invest her first loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles ($100 USD) in breeding small animals such as sheep and pigs, a business she started when she joined the bank and at which she works with her husband. She will use this loan of S/: 2500.00 nuevos soles ($825 USD) to buy a cow for fattening up, as well as fodder. She will repay the loan in 5 installments. Her wish is to improve her earnings and thus increase her capital.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy 1 cow and fodder to fatten it up.

loan.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Asunta pertenece al Banco Comunal â€œEspÃ­ritu Santoâ€ del Centro Poblado D. Chimbo, del Distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo del Departamento D. Puno. Tiene 41 aÃ±os D. edad y es madre D. 6 hijos, 2 mayores D. edad y 4 que aun dependen D. ella, estudio el sexto grado D. primaria, es casada, su esposo trabaja en el Terminal Terrestre D. la Ciudad D. Tacna y tambiÃ©n tiene a cargo la educaciÃ³n D. sus hijos que estudian allÃ¡. Asunta con el primer prÃ©stamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro un chancho para engorD.. Tiene 8 aÃ±os trabajando con el Banco.
En la actualidad se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores y venta D. ropas que compra en Desaguadero y lleva a Tacna, con el fin D. pagar puntualmente su prestamo
Con este prÃ©stamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el cual serÃ¡ pagado en 5 meses, comprara un toro (ganado vacuno) a S/. 2.200 y forraje para alimentar su ganado.
Ella desea vivir en Tacna e iniciar su negocio allÃ¡ para seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms Asunta belongs to the community bank â€œEspÃ­ritu Santoâ€ of Centro Poblado in Chimbo, in the district and province of Yunguyo in the department of Puno. She is 41 years old and the mother of 6 children: 2 are adults and 4 are still dependent on her. She completed GraD. 6 and is married. Her husband works in the bus terminal of the city of Tacna. She is also responsible for the education of her children who live in Tacna. Asunta bought a pig for fattening up with the first loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles ($100 USD) which she received from Manuela Ramos. She has been a member of the community bank for 8 years. She currently raises small animals as well as sells clothing which she buys in Desaguadero and brings to Tacna, all in order to repay her loan punctually. With this loan of S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles ($975 USD), which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy a bull (cattle) for S/. 2.200 ($700 USD) and fodder for the cattle. She wants to live in Tacna and base her business there in order to continue supporting her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy cattle (a bull) and fodder for cattle.

loan.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Alejandrina pertenece al Banco Comunal â€œSanta Cruz D. Cacorcoâ€ del distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 36 aÃ±os, es madre D. 5 hijos, es casada, su esposo trabaja en la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno para engorD.. Con el primer prÃ©stamo recibido D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro habas D. Bolivia, ella empezÃ³ con este negocio hace 15 aÃ±os, viaja muy seguido a la Frontera a comprar mercaderÃ­a. Actualmente y junto a su esposo continÃºan con ambos negocios.
Con el prÃ©stamo que solicitara D. S/: 1700.00 nuevos soles que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara 5 sacos D. habas.
Su deseo es seguir viajando y tener mÃ¡s capital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Alejandrina belongs to the Banco Comunal "Santa Cruz D. Cacorco" in the district of Copani in the Yunguyo-Puno province. She is 36 years old, has 5 children and is married. Her husband buys and sells feedlot cattle. With her first loan, she received S/. 500.00 to increase her capital and buy Bolivian beans. She began with this business 15 years ago. She frequently travels to the border to buy merchandise. Presently, she and her husband work together in both businesses. She is requesting a loan of S/. 1700.00 loan, which she plans on repaying in 4 installments. With this loan, she will buy 5 sacks of beans. Her dream is to continue traveling and increase profits from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy beans wholesale

loan.name: Santusa

texts.es:
DoÃ±a Santusa es socia del Banco Comunal â€œChojchoniâ€ ubicado en el Distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 74 aÃ±os de edad, es madre de 4 hijos mayores vive en el sector Pallcacato, asistiÃ³ al Programa de AlfabetizaciÃ³n, es casada y su esposo le ayuda a vender golosinas, los dÃ­as de feria. Con el prÃ©stamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro ganado vacuno y ovino para engorde despuÃ©s de 2 aÃ±os decidiÃ³ cambiar de negocio e iniciar con la venta de golosinas. Hace 4 aÃ±os que trabaja con Manuela Ramos. Actualmente sigue con la actividad econÃ³mica de venta de golosinas.
Con el prÃ©stamo que solicitara de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles el cual serÃ¡ pagado en 4 cuotas comprara una vaca (ganado vacuno) para engorde.
Su deseo es continuar trabajando con el Banco y continuar con su negocio hasta donde pueda.
texts.en:
Dona Santusa is a member of the communal bank "Chojchoni" located in the Copani district of Peru's Yunguyo-Puno province. She is 74 years old and married with 4 grown children. She lives in the Pallcacato area, and has attended a literacy program. Santusa's husband helps her sell candy during street market days.

With a previous loan of 300 Peruvian Soles (US $100), Santusa bought cattle and sheep to fatten. After 2 years, she decided to change businesses and began selling sweets, which she continues to do. She has been working with Manuela Ramos (the microfinance partner) for 4 years.

Dona Santusa is requesting a loan of 800 Peruvian Soles (US $275) to buy a cow to fatten. The loan will be repaid in 4 installments.

Dona Santusa's desire is to continue working with Manuela Ramos and to take her business as far as she can.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase a cow to fatten.

loan.name: Pacisa

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Pacisa es socia del Banco Comunal â€œSanta Cruz de Cacorcoâ€, ella vive en el Sector Cacorco del Distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 34 aÃ±os, es casada y madre de 4 hijos que estudian todavÃ­a, su esposo trabaja junto con ella en el negocio de compra y venta de ganado ovino. Con el prÃ©stamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro mas ganado ovino para engorde. En la actualidad cuenta con 12 ovejas que venderÃ¡ para pagar su prÃ©stamo con exactitud.
Con el ultimo prÃ©stamo de S/. 800 .00 nuevos soles que solicitara comprara mas ganado ovino (5 ovejas) de Bolivia.
Pacisa expresa que los bancos de Manuela Ramos son de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pacisa is a member of the communal bank "Santa Cruz de Cacorco." She lives in the Cacorco sector of the Copani district in Yunguyo-Puno province (Peru). She is 34 years old and married with 4 children who are still studying. She and her husband work together in their business of buying and selling of sheep.

With a previous loan of 300 Peruvian Soles (US $100), Pacisa increased her capital and bought more sheep to fatten.

Pacisa currently has 12 sheep, which she will sell to pay back her loan. With the latest loan of 800 Peruvian Soles (US $275) that she is requesting, Pacisa will buy 5 more sheep from Bolivia.

Pacisa says that Manuela Ramos (the microfinance partner) is a great help.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase 5 sheep to fatten.

loan.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Petrona es socia del Banco Comunal â€œSanta Cruz D. Cacorcoâ€ del distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 59 aÃ±os, es casada y madre D. 07 hijos que ya formaron sus familias, asistiÃ³ al Programa D. AlfabetizaciÃ³n durante 01 aÃ±o, su esposo se dedica a reparar radios y televisores. DoÃ±a Petrona con el primer prÃ©stamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles deciD. invertir en la compra D. mercaderÃ­a para su pequeÃ±a tienda D. abarrotes. Tiene 5 aÃ±os trabajando con Manuela Ramos. Actualmente sigue vendiendo en su tiendita, ella abre todos los dÃ­as, viaja a comprar sus productos a Desaguadero.
Con el prÃ©stamo que recibirÃ¡ D. S/. 800.00 nuevos soles y que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara arroz, azÃºcar, fideos y aceite.
texts.en:
Mrs. Petrona Q. D. C. is a member of the communal bank "Santa Cruz D. Cacorco" in the Copani district of Yunguyo-Puno province (Peru). She is 59 years old and married, with 7 grown children who have already started their own families. Mrs. Petrona attended a literacy program for 1 year. Her husband repairs radios and televisions for a living.

Mrs. Petrona decided to invest her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles (US $100) in buying merchandise for her small grocery store. She has been working with Manuela Ramos (the microfinance partner) for 5 years.

Mrs. Petrona continues to sell goods in her shop, which she opens daily. She travels to Desaguadero to buy her products. With the new loan of 800 Peruvian Soles (US $275) she receives, Mrs. Petrona will buy rice, sugar, noodles and oil. Mrs. Petrona will repay the loan in 4 installments.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase rice, sugar, noodles, and oil.

loan.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal â€œSanta Cruz D. Cacorcoâ€ del distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 50 aÃ±os D. edad ,es madre D. 1 hijo que vive en Tacna, ella trabaja junto a su esposo en la crianza D. ganado porcino. Con el primer prÃ©stamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro 03 chanchitos para engordar, nos cuenta que vive con su mama por que su papa falleciÃ³ hace un aÃ±o. En la actualidad continua con la crianza D. estos animales para despuÃ©s venderlos y poder pagar su cuota mensual.
Con el prÃ©stamo que recibirÃ¡ D. S/. 1000.00nuevos soles comprara 01 ganado vacuno para engorD., dicho monto lo pagara en 4 meses.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of â€œSanta Cruz D. Cacorcoâ€ Community Bank in the Copani district of Yunguyo-Puno province. She is 50 years old, lives with her mother because her father died a year ago, and is the mother of one child who lives in Tacna. She and her husband raise pigs. With her first loan (of 300 Peruvian â€œnuevos soles,â€ approximately US $100), she purchased three baby pigs to fatten. She continues raising these animals in order to later sell them and make her monthly payments. With this loan of S/1000 (US $325), which will be repaid in four months, she will buy one head of cattle to fatten.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase one head of cattle to fatten.

loan.name: Yaroslav

texts.en:
Yaroslav is married with a 2-year-old daughter and lives in Belaya Tserkov, a busy town in the Kiev region. Yaroslav runs a kiosk selling varnish, coloring agents and dishware in the central market of Belaya Tserkov. He inherited this business from his father, generating his equity capital while working in Germany before returning to continue their family business. He has been running it for 6 years. Currently, he has about 10,000 Grivnas invested in inventory with income of about 6,400 Grivnas a month.
Yaroslav would like to get a 5,000 Grivna loan to purchase assorted merchandise wholesale as retail prices might go up very soon. This would allow him to keep his selling prices competitive and bring him additional profit. Yaroslav is seeking to achieve financial stability for his family. He is the only breadwinner in the family and has to provide for his family and retired father who lives with them. We believe Yaroslavâ€™s willingness to see his business become more diversified and sustainable will ensure success of his trade and prompt repayment of the current loan.

loan.use: To increase inventory

loan.name: Rostislav

texts.en:
For the last year, Rostislav has been investing his time and finances into developing his small business in Ivano-Frankivsk. He offers purified water supply and delivery services. Gained experience has equipped him to be a very successful entrepreneur. His business has grown to the point where he has been able to invest about 10,000 Grivnas in turnover capital.
Rostislav is known as a goal oriented business owner who is optimistic about the future. He is dreaming about developing a second business selling computers and offering related technical maintenance services. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 Grivnas to cover maintenance costs for his van which he uses to deliver water bottles to different locations in his home town. We believe financial assistance will help Rostislav continually meet the needs of his customers while providing for his own financial responsibilities.

loan.use: To cover van maintenance costs

loan.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya decided to start her own business and become self-sustaining 10 years ago. Ever since she has been getting closer to her dream. Presently, her business has grown a lot and she already has about 8,000 Grivnas invested in stock. Nataliya sells a range of retail items, like perfumes, leather goods and cheap jewellery in one of the local outdoor markets. She has been a salesperson for several years and is very open-hearted, sociable and polite. Nataliya is very good at her business, with a perfect credit history in â€œNadiya Ukraineâ€ and a good reputation among other market vendors. She has two vending facilities in her home town of Zaporozhye.
Nataliya wants to get a loan of 2,500 Grivnas which she will invest in increasing her inventory and purchasing new retail items in bulk. This will help her meet the needs and demands of her customers this holiday season. The loan will give Nataliya a chance to expand her trade and increase sales. She will be able to use the profits to invest in her familyâ€™s welfare and further growth of her business.
Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loan.use: To increase turnover capital

loan.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 20 aÃ±os. es soltera vive en casa de sus padres. La Isla Tata kily del Lago Titicaca es el lugar donde Pilar tiene su pequeÃ±o puesto de venta de artesanÃ­as ella, elabora collares y algunos artÃ­culos elaborados en base a totora(planta andina) y compra los hechos en cerÃ¡mica, para ofrecer a los turistas que visitan su isla de diferentes lugares del mundo. A Pilar le gusta hablar con los turistas los cuales le cuentan como son las cosas en sus paÃ­ses y tambiÃ©n algunas palabras que le resultan fascinantes, es por eso que ella busca dejar en alto el nombre de su pueblo y de su paÃ­s con las artesanÃ­as que vende esperando hacer la estadÃ­a de sus visitantes mucho mÃ¡s placentera. Es su primer prÃ©stamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita comprara mÃ¡s artesanÃ­as en base a cerÃ¡mica y algunos materiales para elaborar collares, etc y asÃ­ aumentar su producciÃ³n para ofrecer mejores productos a los turistas que gentilmente los visitan.
texts.en:
Pilar, 20, is single and lives at home with her parents. She operates a small crafts business on Lake Titcaca's Isla Tata Kily. She makes necklaces and other items from "totora" (a reed-like Andean plant) and buys ceramic items, all of which she sells to the tourists who come to the island from all over the world. Pilar enjoys talking to the tourists who tell her about life in their countries, something that fascinates her. In turn, she seeks to pass along a little bit of her village and her country with the crafts that she sells, hoping that they will remember their visit to the island with great pleasure. This is her first loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. With the loan, she will buy more ceramic products and materials for making necklaces, etc. so that she can increase her production and offer her customers better products when they kindly stop by to take a look.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy products for resell.

loan.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with one son. She is a Technical school graduate and worked for a while as a design engineer, but was unable to earn a stable salary. Seeking another source of income, Ludmila decided to start her own small business. She rented a kiosk and began selling household chemicals. Recently, however, Ludmila decided to make a change in the type of products she offers and start selling knitted wear and caps. She believes this new area of trade will help her generate additional profit.
Ludmila has been in business for 15 years and can easily guess the preferences of her clients which helps build customer loyalty. Her integrity and perseverance have helped Ludmila keep her business stable throughout all these years. Presently, Ludmila has around 10,000 Grivnas of working capital. Her monthly profit amounts to 2,500 Grivnas. Ludmila would like to get a loan for 6,000 Grivnas to buy more clothing products. She is planning to purchase knitted wear and warm caps that always sell well in Ukraine in winter. This loan will help Ludmilaâ€™s business continue to grow ensuring the well-being of her family and helping to provide an education for her son at a good college.

loan.use: To increase turnover capital

loan.name: Carlota

texts.es: Carlota tiene 47 aÃ±os, vive con sus 2 hijos universitarios. Trabaja desde hace 12 aÃ±os en la venta de artÃ­culos de cuero y de cuerina en un stand que alquilÃ³ ubicado en el centro de su ciudad, por ser esta, una zona comercial, le garantiza los ingresos para que siga adelante, diariamente con ayuda de sus hijos. Carlota se asegura de adquirir carteras y billeteras con modelos innovadores y tambiÃ©n de buena calidad, despuÃ©s de estos 12 aÃ±os dedicÃ¡ndose a esta actividad, tiene todos los deseos de seguir adelante para continuar sosteniendo la educaciÃ³n de sus 2 hijos. Para Carlota hay meses D. aÃ±o que son difÃ­ciles por las ventas disminuidas, asÃ­ como otros meses, como en navidad, en los cuales tiene mucho Ã©xito y lo aprovecha al mÃ¡ximo. Es la primera vez que estÃ¡ solicitando un prÃ©stamo con MFP, pero se compromete a ser una persona puntual y responsable con su devoluciÃ³n D. prÃ©stamo. Carlota desea invertir en mÃ¡s mercaderÃ­a, es decir, comprarÃ¡ al por mayor directamente de fÃ¡bricas, las carteras y billeteras para abastecerse y aprovechar la campaÃ±a navideÃ±a.
texts.en:
Carlota is 47 years old. She lives with her two sons, both of whom are university students. For 12 years, she has sold leather and imitation leather goods in a rented stand located in the center of the city. Because of her stand's location in a commercial district, she is guaranteed the income she needs to advance her business. She works in the stand everyday with the help of her sons. Carlota makes sure to procure purses and wallets with innovative designs that are of high quality. After 12 years in this line of work, she has every desire to keep going and continue financing the education of her two sons. For Carlota, there are some months of the year which are more difficult due to decreased sales. During other months, such as Christmas time, her business is very successful. She makes sure to take full advantage of those months.

This is the first time she is requesting a loan with MFP, but she promises to be punctual and responsible with the repayment. Carlota wants to invest in more merchandise by purchasing products wholesale directly from the factories. This way she can meet the anticipated demand and take full advantage of the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy wholesale merchandise directly from the factory

loan.name: Dario

texts.es: DarÃ­o vive con su esposa y sus 2 Ãºltimos hijos. Lleva muchos aÃ±os dedicÃ¡ndose a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, ya suman 20 aÃ±os de esta labor, Ã©l cultiva cereales y tubÃ©rculos, y en la cosecha vende todo el fruto de es esfuerzo a fin de que pueda cubrir los gastos de su hogar. TambiÃ©n se dedica a la crianza de animales, principalmente vacas y toros que vende en la feria despuÃ©s de un tiempo de tenerlos, con las ventas adquiere mejores animales y aunque flacos, los hace engordar para que obtenga mejores ganancias. Lo difÃ­cil es cuando el clima perjudica seriamente sus cultivos, por ende, el alimento de sus animales, pero DarÃ­o ha aprendido ha superar estas dificultades y trabajar de una manera beneficiosa. Es la segunda vez que solicita un prÃ©stamo con MFP, habiendo sido puntual en el primer ciclo. Este dinero serÃ¡ invertido en la siembra de papa, para lo cual comprarÃ¡ abono.
texts.en:
DarÃ­o lives with his wife and 2 youngest children. He has been a farmer for years, growing crops and raising animals for over 20 years. He grows grains and tubers, and at harvest time he sells all the products of his labor in order to be able to cover his household expenses. He also raises animals, primarily cows and bulls that he sells in the markets after having them for a while. With the sales of those animals he buys better although skinny animals, which he fattens in order to have greater profits. It is difficult when the weather damages his crops which are what he feeds his animals, but DarÃ­o has learned how to overcome these difficulties and work in a beneficial manner. This is the second time he has asked for a loan with MFP, he was punctual with his first loan. This money will be invested in the sewing of potato and purchasing fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer

loan.name: Elvi

texts.es: Elvi tiene 37 aÃ±os, vive con su esposo e hijos. Desde hace un aÃ±o da pensiÃ³n (menÃº diario) en su casa, por el momento prepara almuerzos, con esto tiene ingresos adicionales para su hogar, asÃ­ estÃ¡ superando una situaciÃ³n difÃ­cil de salud, de la cual se estÃ¡ recuperando recientemente, ahora sigue adelante, y a la par tambiÃ©n realiza diversos servicios, como lavar la ropa de sus vecinos. Elvi a futuro tiene un plan, dedicarse nuevamente a lo que antes era para ella un ingreso mÃ¡s rentable, que es la crianza de cuyes, pero estÃ¡ esperando recuperarse totalmente de una operaciÃ³n de cÃ¡lculos biliares para seguir con mÃ¡s fuerza. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un prÃ©stamo de MFP, demostrando responsabilidad en sus pagos. EstÃ¡ solicitando este dinero como capital para seguir dando pensiÃ³n a sus clientes, comprar los insumos e ingredientes para la preparaciÃ³n de sus platos.
texts.en:
Elvi is 37 years old and she lives with her husband and children. For a year she has provided meals from her home. At the moment she prepares lunches, and this provides additional household income. In this way she can overcome a difficult health situation from which she is currently recuperating. She also offers various services such as washing clothing for her neighbors. In the future Elvi would like to return to a profession that was previously very profitable, which is raising guinea pigs, but she is waiting to fully recover from her gallstone surgery so that she will have full strength. This is the second time she has asked for a loan from MFP, demonstrating her responsibility in her payments. She is asking for this loan as capital to continue providing meals for her customers, buying consumables and ingredients to prepare her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy ingredients and consumables to prepare meals

payment.comment: correction due to overpayment for business 75762

loan.name: Tanya

texts.en:
Tanya is married with a son. She is an entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk where she works in the local bus station, selling interior doors for 2 years. She is characterized as an entrepreneur of integrity by her fellow vendors. Tanya has about 2,000 Grivnas in income.
Some of Tanya's other characteristics are her consistency in customer service, dealing with suppliers and stress, and persistence in her business endeavors. Tanya is an entrepreneur who would never give up, but strives even harder. Tanya hopes to see her trade grow as she makes an investment in equipment for her office to facilitate her operational procedures. Tanya is seeking a 5,000 Grivna loan and is hoping to repay it in 12 months.

loan.use: To purchase equipment for her office

loan.name: Emma

texts.es: Enma tiene 25 aÃ±os, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Ella y su esposo, desde hace 8 aÃ±os tomaron la decisiÃ³n de tener su propia fabrica de ladrillos, antes solo trabajaban en otras fabricas de manera dependiente, ahora el trabajo para ellos es todo un esfuerzo bien recompensado, desde muy temprano ambos se esfuerzan para elaborar los ladrillos que necesitan todo un proceso para su elaboraciÃ³n, demoran hasta 4 dÃ­as en producir millares. Esta actividad es muy rentable, aunque exista Ã©poca de escasez de ventas, pero que son compensadas por las temporadas de abundancia que es durante los meses de marzo y abril, aunque el trabajo se torna sacrificado es una buena fuente de ingresos, que anima a su familia a continuar fabricando ladrillos. Esta es la tercera vez que solicita prÃ©stamo en MFP y hasta el momento ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos. Solicita este dinero para la compra de troncos y aserrÃ­n, que son necesarios para la fabricaciÃ³n de los ladrillos, ademÃ¡s pagarÃ¡ el arriendo de parte de espacio donde tiene su fabrica de ladrillos. La camionada de aserrÃ­n estÃ¡ valorizada en 600 soles, y los palos y troncos serÃ¡n comprados con el dinero restante.
texts.en:
Emma, 25, lives with her husband and 4 children. She and her husband decided 8 years ago to set up their own brick factory. Before that, they had worked in other factories for other people. Now they work for themselves and reap the full reward for their labor. Starting very early in the morning, they both work hard making bricks, something that requires several steps. It takes 4 days to make thousands. It's a profitable business but seasonal and sales vary depending on the time of year. Sales increase substantially in March and April and, though the work is hard, those months are a good source of income that inspire the family to go on with the business. This is the third time that Emma has applied to MFP for a loan and she's been consistently responsible and punctual in repaying the loans. She's applying for a loan to buy logs and sawdust, materials necessary for making bricks. She will also pay part of the rent on the space where she operates the business. A truckload of sawdust costs 600 soles and she will pay for sticks and logs with the rest of the money.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy materials for brick-making business.

loan.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 59 aÃ±os y vive sola. Se dedica a la contrataciÃ³n de arrendamiento o alquiler de su local para eventos especiales, tambiÃ©n ofrece servicio de buffet, con el cual obtiene las ganancias para solventar la educaciÃ³n de 2 hijos universitarios que estÃ¡n fuera de la ciudad. Su dedicaciÃ³n es de todos los dÃ­as, gracias a ello puede tener buenas entradas econÃ³micas, ya son mÃ¡s de 3 aÃ±os de exhaustiva labor, por la cual Juana se siente muy satisfecha y sabe que siempre tiene que tener operativas las instalaciones e infraestructura de su local para poder alquilarlo a un buen precio, por lo cual tiene deseos de seguir implementÃ¡ndose mÃ¡s para la decoraciÃ³n de su local. Es la primera vez que solicita este prÃ©stamo, pero promete ser muy responsable con los pagos de devoluciÃ³n de su crÃ©dito. Juana solicita este dinero con el que podrÃ¡ abastecer los pedidos de buffet que recientemente ha obtenido, esto consiste en comprar los alimentos por cantidad y al por mayor.
texts.en:
Juana is 59 years old and lives alone. She rents or hires out a site for special events and also offers a buffet service, with which she obtains profits to pay for the education of her two university-age sons who are outside the city. Thanks to her constant dedication, she has a good economic income from the last three years of exahustive labour. As a result Juana feels very satisfied and she knows she always has to keep the instalations and infrastructure of her business active in order to be able to hire them at a good price. For this reason she wants to continue installing more decorations on-site. It is the first time shes asked for a loan, but she promises to be very responsible with the repayments of her loan. Juana has requested this money so that she can fill the buffet orders which she has recently obtained, which means purchasing food wholesale and in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase ingredients for her buffet service

loan.name: Lily

texts.es: Lily tiene 38 aÃ±os, en la actualidad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Es docente de profesiÃ³n, pero diariamente, en sus tiempos libres, generalmente en las tardes, ella y su cuÃ±ada elaboran yogurt de diferentes sabores, en su misma casa han implementado un espacio para la preparaciÃ³n de estos con los estÃ¡ndares exigidos en cuanto a higiene se refiere. Los fines de semana se dirigen a las principales ferias comerciales para vender los yogurt, lo mÃ¡s difÃ­cil es cuando existe mucha competencia, ya que existen muchos comerciantes del mismo producto, pero Lily estÃ¡ pendiente siempre de ver las mejoras de su producto para que su consumo sea mÃ¡s aceptado. Es la tercera vez que solicita este prÃ©stamo con MFP, en los cuales se ha portado de manera responsable. Este dinero serÃ¡ invertido en la compra de los insumos y materiales necesarios para la elaboraciÃ³n del yogurt, como los envases e ingredientes como los saborizantes y leche.
texts.en:
Lily, 38, lives with her husand and their 2 children. She's a teacher by profession, but in her spare time--afternoons, generally--during the week, she and her sister-in-law make different kinds of yogurt for sale. They have set up a space in Lily's house to make the yogurt which is processed to the standards of hygiene that yogurt requires. At weekends, they go to the principal fairs in the area to sell the yogurt. The main challenge is competition because there are lots of vendors selling the same product, but Lily is committed to ensuring that her product is the best because she wants to draw in as many customers as possible. This is her third MFP loan and she's demonstrated a responsible manner in the past. This loan will be used to buy the supplies and materials necessary to make yogurt: bottles, for example, and ingredients such as flavoring and milk.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy supplies and materials for yogurt business.

loan.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma vive con su esposo y su hijo. NaciÃ³ en una familia netamente agrÃ­cola y ganadera, de ahÃ­ que tambiÃ©n optÃ³ por dedicarse a esta actividad, junto a su esposo siembran papa, olluco, oca y cebada por temporadas, de acuerdo a las condiciones climÃ¡ticas, una vez que se acerca la cosecha, lleva a vender sus productos a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde obtiene las ganancias de su trabajo. Mientras que todavÃ­a no llega la Ã©poca de la cosecha Norma y su esposo concentran sus actividades en la crianza y venta de sus animales, ya que tiene mayormente ovejas. Es la segunda vez que Norma solicita un prÃ©stamo en MFP, en el primero demostrÃ³ puntualidad y responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas de crÃ©dito. El dinero que solicita ahora es para compra de 4 sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Norma lives with her husband and son. She was born into a farming family and she's chosen to make her own living by farming. She and her husband grow seasonal products such as potatoes, barley, "olluco" and "oca" [olluco and oca are foodcrops] in accordance with local weather conditions. At harvest time, she takes the crops to the city of Huancayo where she can make the most money for her work. Before the harvest, Norma and her husband concentrate on raising and selling their animals, most of which are sheep. This is Norma's second MFP loan. With the first, she showed herself to be punctual and responsible in repaying her loan. This loan will be used to buy 4 sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy fertilizer for farming business.

loan.name: El Amor Group

texts.en:
"El Amor" is a large group of 25 borrowers. In this loan, 5 members of this group are hoping to receive their third loan. The first two loans helped each of these members start a small business, and all members started to experience a little bit of success.

Martina R. is the group representative, and a perfect example of the power of micro credit. Martina took her first two loans and started a small business selling used clothing. She has really increased her business, and is finally starting to feel able to take care of her family. Martina is the mother to 4 children, and would love to send all her children to college someday. She is very excited about the things that are starting to happen in her life, and ready for the challenges ahead.

On behalf of Martina, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support.

loan.use: Buy used clothing

loan.name: Santa Isabel

texts.es: Santa Isabel tiene 56 aÃ±os, vive con su esposo y su Ãºltima hija. DesD. que fue niÃ±a le ha gustado realizar variedad D. tejidos, es asÃ­ que teje todo tipo D. gorros, chalinas, ponchos, entre otros, los venD. a los negociantes D. gran escaL., esta opciÃ³n fue muy buen para DoÃ±a Santa Isabel, desD. que migrÃ³ del campo a L. ciudad, antes L. agricultura era L. Ãºnica fuente D. ingreso, pero ahora tambiÃ©n lo son los tejidos, lo cual le ayuda significativamente para sostener L. educaciÃ³n D. sus hija menor. A pesar D. vivir mucho tiempo en L. ciudad no ha dejado D. dedicarse a las tareas agrÃ­colas, siembra papa y maÃ­z, y cuando cosecha se los lleva a vender al mercado, pero esto solo suceD. cada 6 meses, por lo cual el ingreso fijo para elL. son los tejidos. Realmente disfruta realizar sus tejidos. Se estÃ¡ iniciando como cliente D. MFP, pero su historial crediticio es limpio. Solicita este prÃ©stamo para invertir en L. compra D. lana por kilos, para seguir tejiendo, ademÃ¡s D. comprar 3 sacos D. abono para sus cultivos D. papa.
texts.en:
Santa Isabel, 56, lives with her husband and her youngest daughter. She's enjoyed weaving cloth since she was a girl, which is how she came to set up a weaving business manufacturing all kinds of hats, "chalinas", ponchos and other clothing items. She sells them to bigger businesses, a good option for her now that she's moved from the country to the city. Her only source of income before was farming but now she has the weaving business which has helped her to pay for her youngest daughter's education. Despite having lived in the city for some time, she still works at farming, growing potatoes and maize, which she takes to market for sale at harvest time. The harvest only rolls around every 6 months, though, and the weaving business provides her with a fixed income. She truly enjoys her work. This is her first MFP loan but her credit history is clean. She's applying for a loan to buy bundles of wool by the kilo so that can continue her weaving business. She will also buy 3 sacks of fertilizer to grow potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy wool for weaving business.

loan.name: Tito

texts.es: Tito tiene 35 aÃ±os, es casado y vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Trabaja desde hace 6 aÃ±os a la cerrajerÃ­a, en un comienzo era un trabajador mÃ¡s de un taller, pero dio un paso firme para implementar su propio taller y ser independiente, realiza todo tipo de trabajo en carpinterÃ­a metÃ¡lica, de acuerdo a los trabajos que le solicitan y por medio de ello ha adquirido contratos que le permiten tener buenas ganancias. Tito estÃ¡ contento con su labor, porque es independiente, ademÃ¡s puede disponer de su tiempo libre para atender a sus hijos, su deseo es seguir adelante, por el bien de su esposa y de sus hijos, por lo cual continuarÃ¡ esforzÃ¡ndose. En esta oportunidad, es la tercera vez que solicita un crÃ©dito, durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. Tito solicita este prÃ©stamo con el que podrÃ¡ comprar fierros al por mayor, para seguir fabricando sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Tito, 35, is married and lives with his wife and their 2 children. He worked at a locksmith's shop for 6 years, first as a laborer and then as a craftsman. He's now taken firm steps to set up his own shop and become independent, doing all kinds of work related to shaping metal, depending on what his customers want. He's already received orders that will allow him to earn a good living. Tito is happy with his work because he's independent and because he now has time to spend with his kids. He's striving to get ahead, to make a better live for his wife and children, and he'll continue to work hard for them. This is the the third loan for which he's applied and he showed himself to be punctual in repaying past loans. He's applying for this loans so that he can buy wholesale supplies of iron in order to continue making his products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy wholesale supplies of iron for metal-shaping business.

loan.name: Tula

texts.es: Tula tiene 50 aÃ±os, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace un aÃ±o decidiÃ³ dar un giro completo en sus actividades para generarse recursos econÃ³micos en su propia casa, mediante un locutorio, donde ademÃ¡s de ofrecer el servicio de fotocopias. ArrendÃ³ un local en una zona cÃ©ntrica de su ciudad para asegurarse las ventas, considera que ha sido un aÃ±o de Ã©xitos, lo que la motiva a perseverar en este negocio y con miras a expandirlo para seguir progresando. EL servicio que ofrece en su establecimiento es diario, con su amable y cÃ¡lida atenciÃ³n logra captar nuevos clientes, una ligera dificultad es la competencia, por lo que quiere ofrecer un mejor servicio. Tula es una de las clientas mÃ¡s fieles que tiene MFP, estuvo en un grupo en Jauja (a 1 hora de distancia), pero se mudÃ³ y ahora ha empezado en esta zona con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita invertirÃ¡ en la compra de una cabina mÃ¡s y para el mantenimiento de su fotocopiadora. Ambos, suman la cantidad que solicita.
texts.en:
Tula is fifty years old and lives with her husband and their three children. A year ago she decided to make a a complete change in her activities to generate economic resources from her own home by opening up a phone booth store ("un locuturio," a place where long distance calls can be made at a cheaper a rate) as well as offering photocopy services. She leases a location in the center of their city to insure sales, and considering she has had a year of successes, she is motivated to continue in this business and has thoughts of expanding it to keep progressing. She offers these services every day at her store. With her friendly and warm attention, she gains new clients. A small challenge though is the competition, which is why she wants to offer better service. Tula is one of the most loyal clients that MFP has. Previously she was a member of a group in Jauja (one hour from her current location), but she moved and now has begun in this zone with MFP. With the money requested, she will invest in purchasing another booth and pay for the maintenance of her photocopier. These two goals sum up to the quantity of money that she has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase a booth for her phone booth store and pay for maintenance of her photocopying machine.

loan.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 26 aÃ±os, vive con su esposo y dos hijos. Se dedica de manera independiente a la agricultura desde hace 10 aÃ±os, siembra papa, cebada y habas; tambiÃ©n vende animales, todos los dÃ­as lunes los lleva a una localidad cercana a su zona, de esta manera Vilma asegura el ingreso familiar. El trabajo que realiza es siempre junto con su esposo, a pesar de los dÃ­as muy calurosos ella no se desalienta, porque estÃ¡ habituada a esta forma de trabajo y ademÃ¡s ahora se estÃ¡ impulsando mÃ¡s porque tiene en mente mejorar cada vez mÃ¡s. Esta es la primera vez que solicita el prÃ©stamo y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado responsabilidad. Con este dinero podrÃ¡ invertir en la campaÃ±a de siembra para la papa, tambiÃ©n para el forraje de su ganado. ComprarÃ¡ sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Vilma is 26 years old and lives with her husband and their two children. She is dedicated in an independent manner to agriculture and has been for ten years. She sows potatoes, barley, and beans. She also sells animals, which she brings every Monday to a nearby town in her zone to sell, and in this way she ensures the family income. The work that she does is always done together with her husband in spite of the very hot days when she is not discouraged because she is used to this form of work. Furthermore, she is very driven because she has it in her mind to improve more every day. This is the first time that she has requested a loan and so far she has shown a lot of responsibility. With this money she will be able to invest in sowing potatoes and forraging for her livestock. She will also buy sacks of manure fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Invest in harvesting the potatoes and buying manure fertilizer.

loan.name: Akouwa

texts.en: Mrs A. Akouwa is an expert in selling charcoal . She has other women working with her as a staff. Her staff members are Batchassi Pierrette, A. Akouwa and Passai Celestine, who is standing with her in the picture. Her staff members are also specialized in the charcoal business. Mrs A. Akouwa is requesting a loan of 900 dollars to buy more charcoal which are made from dead wood so that they can bring them in the cities like Lome, Anie, and Aneho to sell to the women who have restaurants and food shops. As Christmas and New Year are coming, women will need charcoal to prepare their food for business and for family needs. Because the market is flourishing at this time of the year, she is sure that she could sell and make more profit at the end of this year and continue the business throughout the next year. She said she will use half of the profit of each month for her family's basic needs (food, particularly) and the other half to pay back the loan. Thank you for supporting her small business.

loan.use: Charcoal and sell it in Lome, and other cities

loan.name: Fransisco Jose

texts.es:
Francisco JosÃ© C. tiene la edad de 43, su estado civil es casado, el tiene 3 hijos de los cuales su hija de 21 aÃ±os de edad estudia anales clÃ­nico, un varÃ³n de 19 aÃ±os que recientemente cursa el 5 aÃ±o de bachillerato y una niÃ±a de 9 aÃ±os que cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su compaÃ±era de vida labora como responsable de la boutique glamour, sus sueÃ±os son de comprar una casa que sea para sus hijos para que asÃ­ puedan vivir unidos y buscar su propia independencia, sus propÃ³sitos son de establecer un negocio en su casa de habitaciÃ³n donde pueda ofrecer mejor su mercaderÃ­a donde sus clientes puedan escoger sus productos .
La actividad econÃ³mica es de mercaderÃ­a en general que expande los productos de: pantalones, camisas, camisas sport y trajes para damas Don Francisco tiene este negocio desde hace 4 aÃ±os, el inicia este negocio por cuenta propia y empieza realizando viajes a Managua donde realiza las compras con pequeÃ±as cantidades de ropa y por sus amistades obtuvo un sin numero de clientes y para suplir la demanda es que decidiÃ³ ampliarse por el cual es el motivo del financiamiento para la compra de mas producto que se realizara en el departamento de Chinandega y Managua para que asi le pueda favorecer mejor.
texts.en:
Francisco, 43, is married and has 3 children: a daughter, 21, who is studying clinical analysis; a son, 19, who recently finished a 5-year baccalaureate; and a daughter, 9, who is in the 4th grade. His wife manages a beauty salon. They would like to buy a house for their children so that they can live together and gradually become independent. Their goal is to set up a shop at home where they could better show their merchandise and serve their customers. Francisco earns his living selling merchandise such as pants, blouses, sports shirts and suits for women. He has owned the business for 4 years. He started it on his own, traveling to Managua where he buys small quantities of clothing. Thanks to his good nature, he has an endless number of customers. He's decided to apply for a loan so that he can meet the demand for his goods. He'll buy wholesale supplies of merchandise in Chinandega and Managua because that's where he can get the best deals.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital.

loan.name: Piyalo

texts.en: Mrs. P. is married and the mother of five children. She has sold food for ten years now. She sells chips made by yam â€œKolikoâ€ every evening. Most of her income comes from that activity which she uses for her family needs. She also helps her husband pay for the rent and invests in education for their children. As school has started, she believes she should buy additional food and respond better to her family's demands. On top of that, she can also sell better during the end-of-year parties and Christmas. Thus, she is requesting a loan of 500 dollars that she will use to buy more yams, potatoes and other staple foods. She says she will be able to pay back her loan within 16 months. She thanks you for your assistance to her vital small business.

loan.use: Local food Restaurant

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Buy fuel

loan.name: Yadira Ferrufino

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Yadira A. Ferrufino tiene la edad de 49 aÃ±os, su estado civil es soltera, solo tiene a su cargo una niÃ±a de la edad de 18 aÃ±os que cursa recientemente el 2 aÃ±o de la carrera de administraciÃ³n turÃ­stica en sus propÃ³sitos esta el de darle mejoras a su vivienda como serian cambiar el techo por lo que es necesario realizar las compras de los materiales para lograr este propÃ³sito y con esto lograra darle las mejoras necesarias a su vivienda por lo que es importante para ella ya que se aproxima la temporada de lluvia y asÃ­ tendrÃ¡ mas protecciÃ³n para su familia.
La actividad econÃ³mica a la DoÃ±a Yadira se dedica es la venta de cosmÃ©ticos, el tiempo que tiene de tener su negocio es de 30 aÃ±os, ella comienza viajando a honduras y Guatemala donde compraba sus productos y venia a entregarlos a sus clientes cuando eran encargos mas tarde debido a su edad decidiÃ³ no seguir viajando y enfocarse mas en las casas comerciales de leÃ³n y selecciono a sus mejores clientes, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que es para la compra de mas producto como: crema, perfumes, body ya que esto es lo que mas vende por lo que es necesario realizar las compras de sus productos.
texts.en:
Yadira A. Ferrufino is 49 years old, single, and only has in her care an 18 year old daughter who recently began her second year of study in tourism administration. Her purpose is to make improvements to her house, such as change the roof, for which it is necessary to buy the materials to achieve this purpose. These improvements to her house are important for her because the wet season is coming and like this she will have more protection for her family. The economic activity of DoÃ±a Yadira is selling cosmetic. She has had her business for 30 years. She began travelling to Honduras and Guatemala where she used to buy her products, and returned to give them to her clients when they placed orders. Later, owing to her age, she decided not to conitnue travelling, and focus more on the companies in LeÃ³n, selecting her best clients. The finance is for working capital to buy more products such as: moisturiser, perfumes, and cream as this is what she sells more, which is why she needs to buy these products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Buy cereal from the rural areas and sell them in town

loan.name: Editha

texts.es:
Editha pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.
Editha tiene 39 aÃ±os de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Es profesora al igual que su esposo, aunque ella fundÃ³ un colegio particular y abriÃ³ una bodega en su casa, ubicada en Acobamba s/n frente a la capilla de Acobamaba. Afirma que ha crecido regularmente porque empezÃ³ su bodega con un prÃ©stamo que le brindaron de S/. 1,000. Actualmente tiene invertido en su pequeÃ±a bodega alrededor de siete mil a ocho mil soles, aunque encarga el negocio muchas veces a su madre por el escaso tiempo que dispone. Manifiesta que este negocio beneficia mucho a su familia porque cuando algo necesitan lo cogen de la bodega.
Con este prÃ©stamo de S/. 2,300, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 8 cuotas, invertirÃ¡ en la compra de panteones porque ya estÃ¡ ingresando la temporada navideÃ±a.
Editha afirma que le gustarÃ­a recibir talleres para mejorar tanto su vida personal como su negocio, aunque por ahora no tiene mucho tiempo disponible.
texts.en:
Editha belongs to the Mujeres al Progreso ("Women for Progress") community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. She is 39 years old and partnered with 2 children. Like her husband, she's a teacher, but she started her own home-based school; she also opened a small grocery in her house in Acobamba, across from the Acobamba chapel. She says that the business has grown steadily since she started it with a S/.1,000 [1,000 Peruvian soles] loan. Edith has now invested about six- to eight-thousand soles in the business even though she's often entrusted it to her mother because she has so little time. She adds that the business has greatly helped her family because when they need something, they get it from the business.

With this S/.2,300 loan, to be repaid in 8 installments, Editha will buy "panetones" [a traditional fruitcake-like bread] for the upcoming Christmas season.

Editha says that she would like to attend workshops, as much to improve her personal life as her business, even though she doesn't have much spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy panetones [a traditional seasonal bread] for resale.

loan.name: Judith Catalina

texts.es:
Judith pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso del distrito y provincia D. Yungay, departamento D. Ancash.
Es casada, tiene tres hijos y a sus 58 aÃ±os D. edad ha crecido. Junto a su esposo, que es jubilado, atienD. su fuente D. soda desD. hace cuatro aÃ±os y tiene a su cargo a 2 D. sus hijos, uno D. ellos, una mujer, es especial, quien llegÃ³ a ser su mayor reto, el criarla. Abastece su negocio por medio D. los agentes distribuidores. Su negocio, poco a poco, ha crecido.
El prÃ©stamo D. S/. 1,500, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 6 cuotas, abastecerÃ¡ su tienda con cerveza y con otros productos que servirÃ¡n para surtir su negocio.
Judith agradece el apoyo que le ha brindado Credimujer para el crecimiento D. su negocio.
texts.en:
Judith is a member of the community bank Mujeres al Progreso from the district and province of Yungay in the department of Ancash. She is married and has three children at her age of 58. Together with her husband, who is retired, she sees after their soda fountain and grocery store and has for the past four years. Two of her children are still under her care, and one of them, a woman, is special and it has been a big challenge raising her. She supplies her business with products from distribution agents. Her business, little by little, has grown. The loan of 1500 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, will supply her store with beer and other products that she will offer to boost her business. Judith is thankful for the support that Credimujer has offered her to help her grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: She will buy beer and other products.

loan.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Al Progreso del distrito y provincia D. Yungay, departamento D. Ancash.
Tiene 60 aÃ±os edad, es casada y tiene seis hijos, aÃºn cuando ya casi todos se han independizado mantiene todavÃ­a a dos D. sus hijas y junto a su esposo trabaja en su panaderÃ­a, desD. hace 30 aÃ±os, el cual se encuentra ubicado en Ranrahirca s/n, en la esquina D. la plaza D. armas D. este centro poblado. Manifiesta que al inicio del negocio empezÃ³ con 10 quintales D. harina por producciÃ³n (1 quintal equivale a 50kg). Ha ido creciendo en su negocio, tan es asÃ­ que en la actualidad produce 80 quintales por dÃ­a y 2 veces por semana. Asegura que su mayor logro ha sido educar a sus hijos para que ellos tengan una profesiÃ³n y construir su casa propia.
Con este prÃ©stamo D. S/. 2,000, el cual serÃ¡ cancelado en 6 meses, comprarÃ¡ especÃ­ficamente con todo el prÃ©stamo, leÃ±a, debido que para calentar el horno es necesario gran cantidad D. leÃ±a.
Natividad menciona que desearÃ­a capacitarse para mejorar su negocio y tambiÃ©n su vida personal.
texts.en:
Natividad is a member of the community bank Mujeres al Progreso from the district and province of Yungay in the department of Ancash. She is sixty years of age, married, and has six children. Though almost all of the children have maD. themselves independent now, she still takes care of two of her daughters. For the past thrity years, she works together with her husband in their bakery, which is located in Ranrahirca, located on the corner of the plaza in the town center. Initially she began the business with 500 kilograms of flour for production. The business has been growing such that today she produces 4000 kilograms per day and twice per week. She affirms that her greatest achievement has been educating her children so that they have a profession and construct their own house. With this loan for 2000 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will purchase firewood, using all of the loan, because to heat the oven a great quantity of wood is needed. Natividad mentioned that she wants to qualify to improve her business and also her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy firewood.

loan.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La microempresaria Isabel C. Ãlvarez tiene 52 aÃ±os de edad, es casada, con 6 hijos, 2 menores que estudian en nivel secundario y 4 adultos que viven en sus propias casas. Esta seÃ±ora tiene una pulperÃ­a desde hace mÃ¡s de 20 aÃ±os cuando emigro de una zona rural de esta regiÃ³n en bÃºsqueda de mejores alternativas para su familia.
Este negocio le permite a la seÃ±ora C. y a su marido poder sustentar el hogar dÃ¡ndoles estudios y otras necesidades mÃ­nimas a sus 2 hijos que viven con ellos.
Sin embargo necesita se le financie lo siguiente:
5 quintales de arroz americano el cual compra a US$ 59 cada quintal, 4 quintales de azÃºcar que compra a US$ 28 cada quintal, 2 quintales de frijoles a US$ 54 cada quintal, 6 bidones de aceite a US$ 25 cada bidÃ³n y 5 quintales de harina a US$ 32 cada quintal.
texts.en:
Small businesswoman Isabel C. Ãlvarez is 52 years old and is married with six children: the two youngest ones who are high school students and four adults who live in their own homes. This woman has owned a shop for more than twenty years when she emigrated from a rural area of this region looking for better alternatives for her family. This business allows Mrs. C. and her husband to support their home and give the two children who live with them an education and other small necessities. Nevertheless, they need to fund the following: 500 lbs. of American rice which costs US$ 59 per 100 lbs. 400 lbs. of sugar which costs US$ 28 per 100 lbs. 200 lbs. of beans at US$ 54 per 100 lbs. 6 drums of oil at US$ 25 per drum 500 lbs. of flour at US$ 32 per 100 lbs.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase 500 lbs of American rice, 400 lbs. of sugar, 200 lbs. of beans, 6 drums of oil, and 500 lbs. of flour.

loan.name: Estefana

texts.es: Estefana lleva 5 aÃ±os, de tener su tienda a la cual le colocÃ³ el nombre de Buenos Aires. Ella se ha dedicado a tiempo completo a dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, ademÃ¡s les ofrece una muy buena calidad en sus productos. Aparte de vender artÃ­culos como: cafÃ©, frijoles, azucar, arroz, (consumo diario) tambien tiene venta de Agua pura en garrafones y Gas propano, y tambien se ha dedicado a la elaboraciÃ³n de prendas de vestir, como: blusas, camisas, vestidos..etc. Estefana tiene 4 hijos los cuÃ¡les la apoyan moralmente en su negocio, una de ellas, le ayuda a atender el negocio cuando ella sale a hacer las compras para la tienda. Gracias a la ayuda que se le brindo anteriormente, ella pudo ampliar su tienda, teniendo variedad de mas productos. El proposito de adquirir un nuevo credito, es para poder comprar un mostrador que le ayude a poder mostrar su producto variado. Tiene en sus planes poder colocar venta de cuadernos, lapices, lapiceros, borradores, (artÃ­culos de librerÃ­a).
texts.en:
Estefana has owned her store, called Buenos Aires, for 5 years. She has worked hard to provide good-quality merchandise to her customers along with good service. In addition to products such as coffee, beans, sugar, rice, Estefana sells jugs of clean water, propane gas, etc. She also makes clothes: blouses, shirts, dresses, etc. Estefena has 4 children who support their mother and help her with the business when they can. One of them tends the store when she has to go out to buy supplies. Thanks to the help that she's received, she's been able to expand the store, adding more products. The purpose of the new loan is to buy a counter where she can display her merchandise. Her plan is to add products such as notebooks, pens, pencils, erasers and other school and office supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Invest in store.

loan.name: Cruz Adilia

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa tiene 56 aÃ±os de edad, habita en un bario de la capital de Managua que se llama la primavera, es madre soltera, con un hijo de 24 aÃ±os de edad, que tiene dificultades ya que es enfermo de sÃ­ndrome de daunw, lo cual para ella es difÃ­cil, ya que necesita muchos cuidado, doÃ±a Rosa logro instalar un salÃ³n de belleza desde hace diez aÃ±os, lo cual inicio con dinero que un banco presto, las dificultades que tiene abecÃ©s es cuando se va la energÃ­a elÃ©ctrica, casi todo el dÃ­a, lo cual ella no puede laborar y es un dÃ­a perdido. Ahora estoy en Afodenic esta es mi segunda solicitud lo cual es de gran beneficios ya que he podido mantener mi negocio y por que tiene taza de interÃ©s bajas con la solicitud de prÃ©stamo es para comprar cosmÃ©ticos, y tratamientos para el cabello ya que estamos en una temporada donde las jÃ³venes comienzan a cambiar de look, y deseo aprovechar a los clientes, espera obtener muchas ganancias para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. A largo plazo es remodelar el local y ampliarlo, y hacerlo en una estÃ©tica, a si como abrir una cuenta de ahorro para asegurarle el patrimonio a mi hijo para que no le falte nada.
texts.en:
SeÃ±ora Rosa is 56 years old, and lives in a suburb of the capital, Managua, known as spring. She is a single mother, with a 24 year old son, who has difficulties because he has down syndrome. This is difficult for her, as he needs a lot of care. SeÃ±ora Rosa managed to install a beauty salon 10 years ago, which she did with a bank loan. The difficulties she sometimes has are when there is no electricity for nearly a whole day, because she can't work and loses a day. Now she is in Afodenic and this is her second request for a loan. From these loans she has received great benefits and has been able to maintain her business, because it has a low interest rate. The loan is to buy cosmetics, and hair treatments. They are now in a time when young people begin to change their look, and she want to make the most of her clients. She hopes to obtain many earnings to continue inveseting in her business. Her long-term objective is to remodel the premises and expand it, making it a cosmetic surgery, so she can open a savings account to ensure that there are assets for her son, so that he doesn't want for anything.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy tints and cosmetics for hair treatments

loan.name: Adilia

texts.es: DoÃ±a Adilia habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Waspan Norte, tiene 28 aÃ±os de edad, casada y con un niÃ±o de 5 aÃ±os de edad, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de la zona franca y se desempeÃ±a como operario en maquinas, la Sra. Adilia vende cosmÃ©ticos desde hace cuatro aÃ±os, lo cual inicio con prestamos de bancos comunales, sus dificultades es cuando las clientas se cambian de domicilio y no le pagan ya que sus productos los vende al contado y al crÃ©dito, con la solicitud que esta solicitando en Afodenic es para invertir en la compra de pacas para vender ropa favorables a los clientes y obtener mejores ingresos ya que todo esta caro, tiene que buscar como promover el dinero. A largo plazo es ampliar su negocio y vender varios productos que les guste a sus clientes.
texts.en:
DoÃ±a Adilia lives in a neighborhood of Managua named Waspan Norte, she is 28 years old, married, with a 5 year-old son. Her husband works operating machinery at an enterprise in the free zone . Mrs. Adilia has been selling cosmetics for four years and she initiated this business with loans from community banks. She has difficulties when her clients move and do not pay the products as she sells in cash or on credit. With the loan requested from Afodenic she will invest in buying clothing in bulk to be able to sell favorable garments to the clients and obtain higher income, and as everything is so expensive she has to find ways of making money. In the long run she will increase business and sell other products that are popular with her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase clothing in bulk.

loan.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Carla Patricia GonzÃ¡lez M. tiene 34 aÃ±os de edad, es casada con dos hijos, ambos menores de edad, tiene desde hace 5 aÃ±os una pulperÃ­a ubicada en un barrio perifÃ©rico de esta ciudad conocido como Loma Fresca y por medio de este negocio ayuda a su marido en los gastos del hogar y a la vez le permite pagar los estudios de sus hijos y sus propios estudios universitarios.
Por la lejanÃ­a del lugar y valorando que el sector donde vive existen pocas pulperÃ­as le permite tener bastantes clientes lo que garantiza la venta de sus productos, sin embargo por no contar con capital suficiente no puede tener variedad de productos ni productos cÃ¡rnicos (res, cerdo) que son parte de la dieta de los costeÃ±os y de esta manera pierde posibles ingresos, por tal razÃ³n requiere se le apoye con un financiamiento para comprar los siguientes productos:
3 Docenas de sopa 3 minutos a US$ 11 cada docena, 24 unidades de leche la lechera a US$ 3.50 cada unidad, quintales de arroz nacional el cual compra a US$ 49 cada quintal, 2 quintales de azÃºcar que compra a US$ 28 cada quintal, 2 quintales de frijoles a US$ 54 cada quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a US$ 25 cada bidÃ³n, 1 exhibidor el cual compra US$ 80, 2 bolsones de papel higiÃ©nico US$ 15.50 cada bolsÃ³n y 20 sacos de carbÃ³n a US$ 3 cada saco.
texts.en:
Ms. Carla Patricia GonzÃ¡lez M. is 34 years old, married and has two minor children. For 5 years, she has owned a grocery store in a suburb called Loma Fresca. Thanks to the grocery store, she has been able to help her husband with the household expenses, as well as paying for her children's schooling and her own university studies. Because of the remoteness of where she lives and the fact that there are few grocery stores nearby, she has many customers, which guarantees the sale of her products. However, due to a lack of working capital, she is unable to offer a greater variety of products, nor can she offer meat products (beef, pork) which are part of the diet of the local coastal people and therefore she is losing potential revenue. She needs you to help her with a loan which she will use to buy the following: 3 dozen 3-minute soups at $11.00 USD per dozen, 24 units of milk at $3.50 per unit, 2 100lb bags of national rice (each bag costs $49 USD), 2 100lb bags of sugar at $28 USD each, 2 100lb bags of beans at $54 USD per bag, 2 bulk cans of oil at $25 USD each, 1 display case which costs $80 USD, 2 bulk bags of toilet paper which each cost $15.50 USD and 20 bags of coal at $3 USD per bag.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy 3 dozen 3-minute soups, 24 units of milk, 2 100lb bags of national rice, 2 100lb bags of sugar, 2 100lb bags of beans, 2 bulk cans of oil, 1 display case for candies, 2 bulk bags of toilet paper and 20 bags of coal.

loan.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: El seÃ±or JosÃ© Samuel C. tiene la edad de 42 aÃ±os habita en la concepciÃ³n junto a su esposa y hijos, la esposa de don JosÃ© trabaja como domestica en una casa particular, para ayudarle con los gastos de la casa y la universidad de unos de sus hijos, el hijo de don JosÃ© tambiÃ©n trabaja como jardinero en casa particular para ayudarse con los pasajes y mensualidad de la universidad. Este seÃ±or tiene un taller de carpinterÃ­a el cual con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado tener ya que es una herencia que le dio su papÃ¡ y la continuado trabajando por tradiciÃ³n ; pero lo que mas se dedica es a la agricultura la mayor preocupaciÃ³n de Ã©l es la falta de financiamiento , el se siente contento por que tiene el apoyo de AFODENIC , que le brinda su mano amiga para que trabaje con sus cultivos y tenga una buena producciÃ³n , este vez solicita la cantidad de C$ 15,000.00 cÃ³rdobas para establecer un cuarto mas de piÃ±a y lo demÃ¡s comprar insumos que lo necesita con mucha importancia los otros cultivos establecidos . Su sueÃ±o es llegar a establecer seis manzana de piÃ±a para poder dejarles herencia a cada uno de sus hijos que al igual que el ; le acostado mantener la producciÃ³n .
texts.en:
JosÃ© Samuel C. is 42 years old and lives in Concpecion together with his wife and children. Jose's wife works as a domestic employee in a private house, in order to help with the household expenses and the university fees of one of their children. Jose's son also works as a gardener in a private house to help with University expenses. Jose has a carpentry workshop which with much effort he has managed to keep going, as the business was inherited from his father and he has continued working using traditional methods. But he dedicates himself above all to agriculture and his major worry is the lack of financing. He feels happy because he has the support of AFODENIC, which has given him a friendly hand so that he can work with his crops and ensure a good harvest. This time he is requesting $15000 Cordobas in order to estabilsh a further field of pineapples and also to buy much-needed materials for the other established crops. His dream is to establish six manzanas (about 10 acres) of pineapples, in order that he can leave an equal inheritance to each of children, who like him have worked hard to maintain production.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase materials such as pesticide and fertilizer to improve crops

loan.name: Liliana Hortencia

texts.es:
