loan.name: Patricio

texts.es: Patricio tiene 43 aÃ±os, es casado, tiene 9 hijos, de los cuales ahora esta viviendo con 4 de sus hijos. Desde los 12 aÃ±os ha trabajado en las chacras de sus vecinos, eran varios hermanos y nos les alcanzaba el dinero, despuÃ©s se casÃ³, en un inicio se dedicÃ³ a la labor de chofer, pero no le agradÃ³, entonces volviÃ³ a la actividad de la agricultura a la que tiene mayor cariÃ±o, ademÃ¡s le es muy rentable en esta temporada que el mercado ha cotizado muy bien sus productos, lo difÃ­cil es en tiempos donde el mercado no paga un buen precio a la papa o arvejas, ademÃ¡s le incomoda la constante alza de precios de los fertilizantes, ahora su dinero ya no le alcanza para lo que antes sÃ­. Este es su primer prÃ©stamo con MFP. Con el dinero va comprar 7 sacos de fertilizante (Nitrato), cada saco cuesta a 146 soles.
texts.en:
Patricio is 43 years old and has nine children, four of whom live with him. Since he was 12 years old, Patricio has worked in his neighbor's farms, where there were various brothers and they helped him earn money. After he married he became a driver, but he didn't like this work. Instead he returned to agriculture, which he cares for very much. Furthermore, agriculture is very profitable in this season and demand is high. The most difficult times are when the market doesn't pay well for potatoes or peas, and the rising price of fertilizer makes Patricio uncomfortable. Now his money doesn't buy as much as it used to. This is his first loan with MFP. With the money he'll buy seven sacks of fertilizer (nitrate), which cost 146 soles each.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer

loan.name: Concepcion

texts.es: ConcepciÃ³n tiene 64 aÃ±os, es casado, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales ya no viven con Ã©l, ahora estÃ¡ viviendo sÃ³lo con su esposa. Desde su juventud se ha dedicado a la agricultura, sembrando hectÃ¡reas tras hectÃ¡rea de papas, pero desde que vio que a su hija le va bien en la crianza de cuyes decidiÃ³ incursionar en este rubro. Entonces su hija le regalÃ³ algunos, Ã©l con mucha emociÃ³n construyÃ³ jaulas, ahora sus vecinos saben que el criÃ¡ cuyes y le hacen pedidos. Y cuando su hija viaja Ã©l aprovecha en enviarle para que los pueda vender; y del mismo modo le ayuda a su hija en el cultivo de su chacra. Sembrar le es dificultoso, por ello es que ahora siembra solo para su consumo personal, la crianza de cuyes le parece mÃ¡s rentable. Este es su segundo prÃ©stamo con MFP, ha sido puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita va comprar cebada para sembrar, esto sirve para la alimentaciÃ³n diaria de sus roedores, otra parte usarÃ¡ para la compra de fertilizantes para su chacra de papa.
texts.en:
ConcepciÃ³n is a 64-year-old married father of 4 children, who no longer live with him. Only he and his wife live at home. Ever since he was young, he has worked in agriculture, growing hectare upon hectare of potatoes. However, ever since he noticed that his daughter was prosperous in raising guinea pigs, he decided to enter this field. His daughter then gave him some of her guinea pigs, and he enthusiastically built cages for them. Now that his neighbors know that he is raising guinea pigs, they order some from him. When his daughter travels, he takes advantage of it, sending her however many guinea pigs she can sell. He also helps his daughter to cultivate her farm. Growing crops is difficult, which is why he only does it for personal consumption. Raising guinea pigs, on the other hand, is more lucrative. This is his second loan with MFP. He has made his payments punctually. With this loan, he will purchase barley for planting, which serves as food for the rodents. He will also purchase fertilizer for his potato farm with the other part of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase fertilizer and plant barley for guinea pig food

loan.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban tiene 49 aÃ±os de edad, se ha quedado viudo hace 4 aÃ±os, de esa relaciÃ³n tuvo 5 hijos, de los cuales estÃ¡ viviendo con el segundo de ellos. Estaban es agricultor, Ãºnica actividad que ha desarrollado toda su vida, le gusta cultivar alverjas, papas, habas, etc., pero lo que nunca deja de sembrar es papa, y ahora el mercado le ha favorecido en el costo, lo que le ha permitido recuperar su inversiÃ³n, en cambio, no ha sembrado mucha alverja, por la falta de dinero. Aparte de esto, tiene ganado, y personas quienes los cuidan, Ã©l solamente los revisa esporÃ¡dicamente. Lo mÃ¡s difÃ­cil en su actividad es el elevado costo de los fertilizantes, porque siembra en sus chacras tanto de regadÃ­o (sistema de riego) y temporales (segÃºn las lluvias), por ello no se abastece con el dinero suficiente para comprar sus fertilizantes. El es un nuevo cliente de MFP. Con el dinero que solicita comprarÃ¡ abono de granjas que por bolsa le cuesta S/.200, invertirÃ¡ un aproximado de S/.1.000.
texts.en:
Esteban is a 49-year-old man who has been a widower for 4 years. He has 5 children, the second of whom lives with him. Esteban is a farmer, as he has been his whole life. He likes to grow peas, potatoes, broad beans, etc., but what he never stops growing are potatoes. The potato stock is up right now, which has allowed him to recoup his investment. On the other hand, he has not been growing very many peas due to a lack of funds. Aside from that, he also has cattle that other people look after. He only occasionally checks on his cattle. The most difficult aspect about his work is the high cost of fertilizers because he grows crops on both irrigated land and seasonal plots (according to the rain), which is why he does not have enough money to buy fertilizer. He is a new MFP member. With the money being requested, he will purchase fertilizer at 200.00 PEN a bag. He will invest approximately 1,000.00 PEN.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase fertilizer for his crop fields

loan.name: Evarista

texts.es: Evarista tiene 23 aÃ±os, es conviviente vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, viven en la casa de sus padres. Se levanta a las 4.00am para prepara el desayuno, a las 8.00am ya estÃ¡ listo el almuerzo, de ahÃ­ tiene que irse a la chacra a unos 4 kilÃ³metros de su pueblo, es por ello que madruga, desde niÃ±a realizÃ³ esta actividad, y ya se acostumbrÃ³, y le es rentable, dice que para la chacra hay que dedicarse a tiempo completo para que produzca muy bien, de ahÃ­ cotiza sus productos en el mercado a un buen precio. La dificultad en la chacra es cuando las diversas enfermedades atacan a las plantas, para evitar ello tiene utilizar preventivos y fumigar cuanto antes para tener una buena cosecha. Es su primer prÃ©stamo con MFP. Con el dinero comprarÃ¡ los productos llamados Ditani y Atoc para fumigar cada 8 dÃ­as, se usa de 2 a 3 cucharadas para cada litro, esta inversiÃ³n serÃ¡ un aproximado de S/. 850.00.
texts.en:
Evarista is 23 years old, lives with her partner and 2 sons in her parents home. Evarista wakes up at 4am everyday to prepare breakfast, and by 8am lunch is ready. By that time she has to go to the small farm about 4km from her town. That is why she wakes up so early. She has been doing this work since she was young, so she is used to it. The farm work she does is profitable. Evarista says that working on a farm you have to work full time so that the farm produces well. She is then able to sell her products in the market at a good price. The difficulty of the farm is all the different illnesses that affect the plants. To avoid these illnesses she has to take several precautions and fumigate in advance, to ensure a good harvest. This is Evarista's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money from the loan she will buy the products (named Ditani and Atoc) to fumigate her farm. She has to use these products every 8 days, using 2-3 spoonfuls for every liter. The investment needed for these fumigation materials is 850 soles

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Staff Member

loan.use: Purchase of insecticide for her farm

loan.name: Fabiana

texts.es: Fabiana tiene 32 aÃ±os, es madre soltera con cuatro hijos, vive tan solo con tres de ellos porque la mayor se fue a trabajar a la ciudad de Lima. Cuando era muy niÃ±a ella ayudaba a trabajar la chacra a sus padres, pero al crecer y tener 2 hijos notÃ³ que no le era suficiente, decidiÃ³ emprender negocio en la crianza de cuyes de raza, gracias a un programa gubernamental le regalaron 2 cuyes; y ella logrÃ³ aumentar los ejemplares. Ahora se dedica a comercializar cada cuy a S/.12 en Tarma (sierra) y aumenta en el mercado de la selva. Ella los proporciona a cada puesto y a la siguiente semana los cobra, le agrada criar cuyes, ya que le es muy rentable, con ello puede educar a sus hijos del nivel primario. Este es su cuarto prÃ©stamo en MFP, ha pagado puntualmente sus cuotas anteriores. Con el dinero que solicita va comprar alimentos para sus cuyes, la otra parte la derivarÃ¡ a la compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo de papa
texts.en:
Fabiana is a 32-year-old single mother with 4 children. She lives with only three of them because the eldest went to work in Lima. When she was very young, she used to work on her parentsâ€™ farm, but as she grew up and had 2 children, she realized it was not enough. She then decided to start a guinea pig business thanks to a government program that gave her 2 guinea pigs. She has managed to increase her herd of guinea pigs. She now sells each one for 12 PEN in Tarma (sierra), and the price increases in the markets of the jungle. She distributes them in each stand, and collects payments the following week. She likes to raise guinea pigs because it is lucrative. With the profits, she can give her children an elementary education. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has paid all her previous loans punctually. With the money she is requesting, she will purchase food for her guinea pigs and fertilizer for her potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase guinea pig food and fertilizer for potato crops

loan.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos tiene 19 aÃ±os de edad, vive con su esposa y una hija de 2 aÃ±itos. Desde niÃ±o se ha dedicado a la agricultura, y ahora que se casÃ³ ha empezado a sembrar ya no solo una o dos chacras, sino que estÃ¡ sembrando papa, arvejas en mayores cantidades, Ã©l siembra de modo alternado, mientras una estÃ¡ cosechando, otra esta lista para limpiar y preparar, y finalmente el otra ya va empezar a sembrar papa. La siembra de la papa le es muy rentable por hay en determinados Ã©pocas donde tiene buen precio y eso lo aprovecha para juntar capital, de ese modo va sembrando otros productos alternados, lo difÃ­cil es cuando la rancha (insecto) ataca a la papa, y si no lo controla perjudica su cosecha. Este es su primer prÃ©stamo con MFP. Con el dinero va comprar un insecticida denominado Atoc, el kilo cuesta S/.60.00 y esto le sirve para controlar la rancha.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 19 years old, and his lives with his wife and two year old daughter. Juan Carlos has been a farmer since he was very young, and now that he's married he's begun to expand his farm beyond only one or two fields. He plants potatoes, and large quantities of peas. Juan Carlos alternates the crops so that while one is growing the other is ready to be cleaned and prepared, until finally be begins to plant potatoes again. Growing potatoes is very profitable because there are certain seasons when prices are higher and farmers have the opportunity to increase their capital. In this way Juan Carlos plants other alternating products. The difficult times are when insects attack the potatoes, and if they're not controlled they'll ruin the harvest. This is Juan Carlos' first loan with MFP. He'll use the money to buy Atoc brand insecticide, a kilo of which costs 60 soles. This will control the insects.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy insecticide for his fields.

loan.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 47 aÃ±os, vive con su esposo, tuvo 11 hijos, de los cuales viven con ella 5. Es agricultora desde su niÃ±ez, se levanta a las 4:00 am para que preparar el desayuno y del mismo modo el almuerzo, asÃ­ dejarlo listo e irse a la chacra llevando el almuerzo para su esposo y quedarse allÃ­ trabajando. Esta actividad le es muy rentable, ya que todo el tiempo ha vivido de su siembra de diversos productos; pero en mayor cantidad de la papa, ahora tiene pensado de sembrar mÃ¡s y para ello necesita contar con insecticidas, que juntamente con la semilla se hecha al momento de sembrar, porque de no poner este, el gusano acabarÃ­a con la papa y no cosecharÃ­a nada. Juana ingresa por vez primera a MFP. Con el prÃ©stamo va comprar el insecticida llamado Temex para que pueda sembrar la papa en su chacra temporal.
texts.en:
Juana is 47 years old and lives with her husband. She had 11 children, five of whom live with her. Juana has been a farmer since childhood. She wakes up at 4:00am to prepare breakfast and lunch. She leaves for the fields and brings the lunch for her husband, staying with him to work. This activity is very profitable, and she's always planted a variety of products, including a large quantity of potatoes. Now she hopes to plant more, but she needs to depend on insecticides. If she doesn't use insecticides at the moment that she plants the seed, worms will kill the potatoes and nothing will grow. This is the first time that Juana has worked with MFP. With the loan she'll buy Temex brand insecticide so that she can plant potatoes in her seasonal field.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy insecticide for her fields.

loan.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 42 aÃ±os, es conviviente, tuvo 5 hijos y que ahora solo viven con ella 3 de ellos. Desde muy niÃ±a se ha dedicado a la agricultura, ahora que tiene su familia siembra en grandes cantidades papa, para ella sembrar papa le ha sido muy rentable porque es un producto que en su temporada lo cotizan a un buen precio en el mercado y gana al doble de su inversiÃ³n, pero en temporada baja, casi no recupera nada. Ella sigue sembrando porque no tiene otra alternativa en quÃ© ocuparse, ni mucho menos otros ingresos, lo Ãºnico es que siembra diversas variedades de productos para compensar sus ingresos. Viene trabajando en su segundo prÃ©stamo con MFP, demostrando puntualidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprarÃ¡ el fertilizante que llaman 18 y nitrato, nos dice que sin este fertilizante, 18, no hace fruto la planta y no se cosecha como deberÃ­a ser.
texts.en:
Maria, 42, is a common-law wife and has 5 children: two are grown and three still live with her. She has been a farmer since she was a little girl. Now that she has a family, she grows large quantities of potatoes. Potatoes are a profitable crop for Maria, because in high demand season, the revenue she gets is twice the investment; but in low season, she does not recover much of her investment. Even in this case, Maria keeps on growing potatoes because she does not have any other work to do, nor any other source of income. She tries to grow different types of vegetables to balance her income. The loan she is requesting is the second from MFP. She has made her payments on time. This time, the loan will be used to buy a fertilizer called 18 and nitrate. She tells us that the fetilizer 18 is needed to make the potatoes grow larger.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Compra de fertilizante para sus cultivos

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 47 aÃ±os, es casada, tuvo 9 hijos, de los cuales ahora con ella viven solamente 5 hijos. Ella es agricultora y sus padres tambiÃ©n, creciÃ³ en ese ambiente; ahora que se ha casado su tarea se ha incrementado porque en horas de la maÃ±ana tiene que dedicarse a preparar los alimentos y despuÃ©s eso de 11.00am se va a la chacra llevando el almuerzo y de pasada a sus carneritos, para pastarlos o sujetarlos en estacas para que pueda trabajar en su chacra. En esta zona de Pachac todos los pobladores siembran papa en grandes cantidades y luego olluco, pero a Rosa le es mÃ¡s rentable sembrar olluco, porque nos dice que a pesar de ser muy sensible a hielo, que si le cae no produce como debe, la papa es mÃ¡s resistente pero se requiere mayor inversiÃ³n. Es su primer prÃ©stamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprarÃ¡ 12 sacos de urea para abonar sus tierras, cada saco cuesta S/.127, en total gastarÃ¡ S/. 1.224.
texts.en:
Rosa is 47 years old, married, with 9 children, though only 5 currently live with her. She, along with her parents, are farmers. She grew up in that environment; but now that she is married, her daily work has increased since in the morning she has to prepare food for her children, then after 11 am, she goes to work on the farm while taking lunch to her husband and taking her rams out to pasture. In the Pachac region where she lives, the people generally grow large quantities of potatoes and olluco (a Peruvian type of potato), but Rosa makes more money growing olluco since it is more weather-resistant; however, it requires a greater investment as well. This is the first loan she has requested from MFP. With the loan, she will purchase 12 sacks of urea to fertilize her land. Each sack costs ~$40, in total, she will spend $480.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase fertilizer for her land

loan.name: Sofia

texts.es: SofÃ­a tiene 58 aÃ±os, es madre D. 9 hijos, ahora solo vive con 5 D. ellos, quienes la apoyan en el trabajo D. la agricultura. Su esposo se dedica a la chacra, siembra papa desD. hace muchos aÃ±os y les va muy bien, esporÃ¡dicamente ella prepara quesos y los lleva al mercado, pero hace un aÃ±o le han pedido hilados D. lana y como tiene bastante lana D. carnero estÃ¡ hilando mientras pastea su ganado, por kilo la venD. a S/.12 dependiendo del grosor del hilado, ella les venD. los artesanos D. San Pedro D. Cajas para que tejan las frazadas o tapices. Se levanta a las 5.00am para preparar el desayuno y el almuerzo, su esposo se va a la chacra llevando su comida, desD. muy joven ha hilado y le agrada lo que realiza, le es rentable y estÃ¡ feliz D. hacerlo. Ya viene trabajando 4 prÃ©stamos con MFP, y ha sido puntual en sus pagos. El dinero serÃ¡ usado en al compra D. una mÃ¡quina D. hilar para que pueda producir mucho mÃ¡s, el resto lo invertirÃ¡ en abono para su chacra.
texts.en:
Sofia is 58 years old and mother of nine children, only five of which live with her now. Those that live with her assist her in farming their land. Her husband also works with them on their farm, cultivating potatoes; they have farmed for many years and it has gone very well for the family. Every now and then, she also makes cheese and takes it to sell in the market. A year ago, customers started to ask her for woolen yarn since she has plenty of wool from the animals on her farm. Now she makes the yard while she takes their livestock out to pasture; she sells it for ~$4/kilo depending on the thickness of the yarn. She sells it to the artisans of San Pedro D. Cajas who make it into blankets and tapistries. She gets up at 5 am to make breakfast and lunch for her family; her husband takes his food to the farm. Since she was young, she has spun yarn and she likes what she does. It is a profitable business and she is happy doing it. This is the fourth loan she has requested from MFP and she has been punctual in her payments. The money will be used to purchase a yarn spinning machine so she can produce more. The rest will be invested in fertilizer for their farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of a yarn spinning machine and fertilizer for farmland

loan.name: Sant Ak KolutÃ© 2 Group

texts.fr: Lâ€™Ã©covillage de Yoff (http://www.sem-fund.org/yoff_fr.php) AprÃ¨s une expÃ©rience acquise avec le premier prÃªt, nous venons solliciter un 2e prÃªt. Ce fonds nous permettra de continuer nos activitÃ©s. Nous allons acheter des matiÃ¨res premiÃ¨res pour teinture, couture, transformation de fruits et lÃ©gumes.
texts.en:
Following its first experience, the eco-village of Yoff (http://www.sem-fund.org/yoff.php) is seeking a second loan. The funds will enable them to continue with their businesses, and will be used to purchase raw materials to be used for making puppets, dyeing, sewing, and to transform fruits and vegetables.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase raw materials to be used for making puppets, dyeing, sewing and to transform fruits and vegetables

loan.name: Victor

texts.es: VÃ­ctor tiene 49 aÃ±os, es casado, tiene 4 hijos, vive solo, tiene inquilinos en casa, que son su compaÃ±Ã­a, su esposa y sus hijos viven en Lima. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cuando su esposa vivÃ­a en el pueblo sembraban en grandes cantidades, pero se fue a la capital para cuidar de sus hijos que estudian por allÃ¡. El ha sembrado 20 sacos de semilla, pero con operarios, contrata una persona para que prepare los alimentos para sus operarios, le agrada mucho la agricultura, es por ello que no puede irse con su familia, solo que tiene dificultades cuando los insectos atacan a sus plantas y ahÃ­ viene su preocupaciÃ³n al no tener dinero suficiente para comprar los insecticidas. Este es su segundo prÃ©stamo con MFP, ha venido siendo puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero va comprar insecticidas como el â€œCursatilâ€, el kilo S/.70 y el â€œFitorasâ€ que sirve para la controlar el insecto llamada â€œranchaâ€, invertirÃ¡ una aproximado S/.1.200.
texts.en:
Victor is 49 years old, married with four children. He lives alone but has tenants in his house which provide him company. His wife and children live in Lima. Since he was very young, he has worked as a farmer; when his wife lived in the village, they grew large quantities of crops but their capital has since gone to support their children in their studies in Lima. He has planted 20 sacks of seeds but has had to hire someone to prepare food for all of his workers. He loves farmwork which is why he can't go to Lima to be with his family. He struggles when insects attack his crops which is why he is worried since he doesn't have enough money to purchase insecticides. This is the second loan he has requested from MFP and he has been punctual in all his payments. With the loan, he will purchase insecticides like Cursatil, which costs ~$23/kilo and Fitoras which helps to fight of the "rancha" bug. He will invest about $400.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase insecticides for his crops

loan.name: Oriente Group

texts.es: hola nosotros somos el grupo Oriente, somos cuatro mujeres muy luchadoras y que nos gusta mucho trabjar, somos muy dedicadas a nuestros negocios y lo mas importante es que somos muy amigas, diria yo casi como hermanas, estas son las actividades que nosotros realizamos: Diany A.: soy la coordinadora del grupo, mi actividad principal es el comercio, tengo 3 aÃ±os de dedicarme a la venta de ropa y zapatos tambien vendo cosmeticos, mis ventas las hago de forma ambulante y por encargos, este negocio me ayuda a contribuir a los gastos de mi hogar. Karla S.: ella tiene un puesto de ventas de frutas, ubicado en la calle principal salida a Jamastran, operado bajo el nombre de frutas Daniela, ella tiene 3 aÃ±os de tener su negocio, ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hermosos hijos, el padre de sus hijos solo le ayuda con el alquiler de la casa y los demas gastos los tiene que poner ella. Rosa A.: ella se dedica a la venta de electrodomesticos para el hogar y tambien vende cosmeticos, los electrodomesticos los vende por encargo y la gente se los paga al credito, sus clientes son de diferentes comunidades vecinas a la Ciudad de Danli. Sorayda B.: ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, ella tiene 2 aÃ±os de dedicarse a este negocio, durante este tiempo le va muy bien y le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, todas nosotras necesitamos el credito ya que viene la epoca de navidad y aqui es cuando las ventas son las mejores, asi que necesitamos el credito para poder surtirnos de mucha mercaderia y asi poder cubrir con las necesidades de todos nuestros clientes.
texts.en:
Hello, we are the Oriente Group. We are four painstaking women who love to work. We are very dedicated to our businesses, and the most important thing is that we are friends, or should I say, almost like sisters. These are the businesses in which we are involved: Diany A.: I am the group coordinator. My main business activity is retail. I have been selling clothing and footwear for 3 years, and I also sell cosmetics. I work as a street vendor and take orders. This business helps me cover the household expenses. Karla S.: has a fruit stand located on the main street that leads to Jamastran. She operates the stand under the name of â€œDaniela Fruit.â€ She has had her business for 3 years. She is a single mother with 2 beautiful children whose father only helps out by paying rent. Karla must cover the rest of the expenses. Rosa A.: sells home appliances and cosmetics for a living. She sells the appliances by catalog, and her customers pay her with credit. Her customers come from several neighboring communities of the city of Danli. Sorayda B.: sells new clothing for a living. She has been in business for 2 years, during which time her business has prospered. She helps her husband with the household expenses. We all need the loan because the holiday season, which is the time when our sales increase, is almost here, so we need to stock up on merchandise in order to meet our customersâ€™ demands.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Pueblo Nuevo Group

texts.es: hola nosotras somos el grupo Pueblo Nuevo, somos tres integrantes, tenemos muchos aÃ±os de conocernos y somos muy unidas, decidimos obtener un credito ya que necesitamos salir adelante con nuestros negocios y mas en esta epoca de navidad que es muy buena y necesitamos inyectarle capital a nuestros negocios, asi podremos salir adelante con nuestras familias. ahora les voy a hacer una pequeÃ±a explicacion sobre lo que nosotras hacemos: Mirian M.: soy la jefe del grupo, mi actividad es el comercio, cuento con un pequeÃ±o negocio de venta de ropa nueva y esta ubicado en mi casa de habitacion, tengo muchos clientes ya que les gusta mi producto porque tiene un precio accesible y es de muy buena calidad la ropa que vendo, soy madre soltera tengo 2 hermosos hijos, los que estan cursando la educacion primaria, gracias a este negocio he podido sacar adelante a mis hijos. Juana Lorena P.: ella se dedica a la confeccion de ropa para damas y niÃ±as, ella es madre soltera, su hija esta en cuarto grado, ella necesita comprar telas y accesorios para poder hacer ropa y venderla a sus clientes, ella trabaja por pedidos. Mirian M.: ella es comerciante, su actividad es la venta de pan casero, ella tiene varios aÃ±os de dedicarse a este negocio, ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, es importante decir que este negocio es el que le ayuda a cubrir con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
We are the three members of the group Pueblo Nuevo (New Village). We have known each other for a long time and are very united. We decided to obtain a loan since we need to grow our businesses especially during Christmas-time which is a period of high sales. We need to inject some capital into our businesses in order to move forward with our families. Allow me to explain what we do: Martha de Jesus: I am the leader of the group and I run a small business selling new clothing out of my home. I have many customers who like my products since they are well-priced and of very good quality. I am a single mother of two beautiful children who are both in elementary school. Thanks to this business, I have been able to support my children. Juana Lorena P.: She works producing clothing for women and children. She is a single mother whose daughter is in 4th grade. She needs to purchase fabric and accesories to make more clothing and sell it to her customers. She makes custom-made clothing for her customers. Mirian M.: She sells homemade bread. She has worked in this business for quite a while. She is a single mother of two children and this business helps to cover her family's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Haydee

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Haydee V. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, el nombre de mi pulperia es Xiomara, tengo un aÃ±o de haber inagurado mi negocio, en estos momentos mi negocio es pequeÃ±o pero tengo muchos deseos de superme y hacer crecer mi negocio lo mas que pueda, soy casada pero ya mi hijo esta grande y no tengo obligaciones con el, porque el ya formo su hogar, mi esposo es albaÃ±il y los dos salimos adelante con los gastos de nuestro hogar, estoy solicitando este credito para poder hacer que mi negocio sea mas grande y asi tener mejores ganancias, estoy feliz ya que me va bien en mi negocio y mis clientes me prefieren porque la atencion que les doy es especial.
texts.en:
My name is Haydee V. and I sell grocery products in my small store called Xiomara. I started my business a year ago; it is still rather small but I have dreams of growing my business all I can. I am married and my son is an adult so I no longer need to provide for him since he already started his own family. My husband is a construction worker and together we are able to cover the family's expenses. I am requesting a loan in order to expand my business and improve my income. I am happy that my business is going well and that my customers prefer me because I provide them great customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise

loan.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar P. vive en la calle Franz Tamayo de la zona 16 de Julio, ciudad de El Alto.
Es madre soltera vive junto a su hijo de 10 aÃ±os de edad.
Trabaja como docente del ciclo bÃ¡sico, en una pequeÃ±a escuela del Ã¡rea.
El crÃ©dito lo destinara en la compra de una computadora, asÃ­ mejorarÃ¡ la enseÃ±anza de sus alumnos, guardando informaciÃ³n para exponer en clase, llevando un registro de las tareas, etc.
Es el primer crÃ©dito con Impro, la evaluaciÃ³n realizada lo califica para otorgar el crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Pilar P. lives on Franz Tamayo street in the 16 de Julio zone in the city of El Alto. She is a single mother that lives with her 10 year old son. She works as an elementary school teacher in a small school in the area. The loan will be used to purchase a computer, which will allow her to improve the instruction of her students by showing information in class, having a record of homework assignments, etc. This is her first loan with Impro, but an analysis was performed that qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of computer for her classroom

loan.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina se dedica a la crÃ­a D. ganado vacuno cuya producciÃ³n D. leche comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota D. Leche).
Vive en la comunidad ChuÃ±ochununi, sector Laja D. la Provincia los Andes del departamento D. La Paz, ubicado a tres horas D. la ciudad D. La Paz.
Es casada, su marido se dedica a la agricultura.TambiÃ©n tiene dos hijos (un varÃ³n D. 18 aÃ±os, una mujer D. 15 aÃ±os).
El credito serÃ¡ invertido para comprar una vaca lechera, es el segundo credito via KIVA, con el primero adquiirio una ternera y va mejorando su producciÃ³n, por lo tanto, su calidad D. vida.
La evaluaciÃ³n realizada le califica para otorgarle el prÃ©stamo.
texts.en:
Sabina works raising cows whose milk she sells to PIL Andina (an industrial milk plant). She lives in the community of ChuÃ±ochununi in the Laja sector, los Andes Province, La Paz department, located three hours from the city of La Paz. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. She also has two children, an 18 year old son and a 15 year old daughter. The loan will be invested to purchase a milk cow. This is her second loan through Kiva; with the first loan she purchased a baby cow, which helped improve her production and therefore her quality of life. An evaluation performed qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of livestock

loan.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El seÃ±or JosÃ© Antonio M. P. tiene 44 aÃ±os de edad, es casado con 2 hijos, ambos son mayores de edad y se encuentran estudiando en la universidad. El microempresario M. tiene desde hace mÃ¡s de 20 aÃ±os un taller de reparaciÃ³n de bicicletas y a la vez vende repuestos de las mismas.
Con esta actividad econÃ³mica a podido sacar adelante a su familia y poder sufragar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos.
Este seÃ±or es abastecido con los repuestos de la capital en parte compra en efectivo y parte es al crÃ©dito pero con plazos relativamente cortos de un mes, lo que lo hace estar bastante presionando por los pagos que debe cumplir.
Por tal razÃ³n esta solicitando para comprar las siguientes piezas de repuestos:
2 Docenas de llantas de bicicleta No 26 a US$ 48 dÃ³lares cada docena, 2 docenas de llantas de bicicleta No 24 a US$ 48 dÃ³lares cada docena, 2 docenas de tubos para bicicletas No 26 a US$ 24 dÃ³lares cada docena, 2 docenas de tubos para bicicletas No 24 a US$ 24 dÃ³lares cada docena, 2 docenas de Rin para bicicleta No 26 a US$ 60 dÃ³lares cada docena, 2 docenas de Rin para bicicleta No 24 a US$ 60 dÃ³lares cada docena, 2 docenas de horquia para bicicleta No 26 a US$ 48 dÃ³lares cada docena, 2 docenas de horquia para bicicleta No 24 a US$ 48 dÃ³lares cada docena, y 1 docena de frenos de aluminio para bicicleta a US$ 80 dÃ³lares cada docena.
texts.en:
SeÃ±or JosÃ© Antonio M. P. is 44 years old and married with two children, both of whom are grown up and studying at university. For more than 20 years, M. has had a business repairing bicycles as well as selling spare parts for bicycles. This business has enabled him and his family to get ahead, and he has been able to cover the costs of his childrenâ€™s university education. He gets the spare parts from the capitalâ€”he buys them partly with cash and partly on credit but with the relative short repayment period of one month. This has put a lot of pressure on him. For this reason he is asking for a loan to buy the following items: two dozen bicycle tyres #26 at US$48 per dozen, two dozen bicycle tyres #24 at US$48 per dozen, two dozen bicycle inner tubes #26 at US$24 per dozen, two dozen bicycle inner tubes #24 at US$24 per dozen, two dozen wheel rims #26 at US$60 per dozen, two dozen wheel rims #24 at US$60 per dozen, two dozen bike forks #26 at US$48 per dozen, two dozen bike forks #24 at US$48 per dozen, and one dozen aluminium brakes at US$80 per dozen.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy bicycle spare parts

loan.name: Julian

texts.es:
Juilian C. se dedica a la crÃ­a de ganado vacuno cuya producciÃ³n de leche comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). AdemÃ¡s, trabaja como encargado de aserradero en la venta de madera en una zona perifÃ©rica de la ciudad de El Alto
Vive en la comunidad ChuÃ±ochununi de la Provincia Loa Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Esta casado, su esposa le colabora en los quehaceres del ganado y su pequeÃ±a de 6 meses.
El crÃ©dito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera, asi incrementarÃ¡ su producciÃ³n de leche, por lo tanto, sus ingresos.
Es el primer crÃ©dito con Impro, la evaluaciÃ³n realizada le califica para otorgarle el prÃ©stamo
texts.en:
Juilian C. works raising cows whose milk he sells to PIL Andina (an industrial milk plant). In addition, he works in a sawmill selling wood in a surrounding area of the city of El Alto. He lives in the community of ChuÃ±ochununi in the province of Los Andes in the La Paz department located three hours from the city of La Paz. He is married and his wife helps him with the cows as well as taking care of her 6 month old daughter. The loan will used to purchase a milk cow which will increase his milk production and therefore his income. This is his first loan with Impro, but an evaluation performed qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of livestock

loan.name: Buen Encuentro Group

texts.es: hola nosotras somos el grupo Buen Encuentro, todas somos mujeres y somos muy responsables y con muchos deseos de superarnos economicamente, somos vecinas y tenemos mucha experiencia en nuestras labores diarias, todas somos madres solteras. nuestro grupo se integra de esta forma: Lastenia O.: soy la coordinadora del grupo, tengo muchos aÃ±os de dedicarme a la venta de cameras, ropa para camas, en este tiempo las ventas son muy buenas, mi producto lo vendo de contado y al credito, ahora necesito tener mucho producto para poder vender mucho en navidad, ya que hay que hacer los pedidos y esto se tarda unos dias y quiero que para antes del 10 de diciembre tener todo mi producto para empezar a venderlo. Martha S.: ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de sopa de mondongo, tambien vende nacatamales, ella tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion, ella para la epoca de navidad tiene muchos nacatamales encargados pero no tiene capital para comprar todos los materiales y por tal razon ella necesita el credito de lo contrario no podra cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Vilma O.: ella vende productos de belleza como ser cosmeticos y tambien vende ropa para cama, tambien ella necesita comprar para poder estar preparada para la epoca de navidad. todas nosotras necesitamos el credito para hacer nuestros negocios mas grandes y asi tener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Hello, we are the Buen Encuentro group. We are all women and are very responsible with a lot of desire to better ourselves economically. In addition, we are all single mothers, as well as neighbors, and have a lot of experience in our daily business activities. Our group is comprised as follows: Lastenia O.: I am the group coordinator and I have many years of experience selling bed linens. Currently, the sales are very good and I sell my product with payment in full and on credit. I need to have a lot of merchandise to be able to sell a lot during the Christmas period, since I have to place my orders to my suppliers which takes several days and I would like to have all my merchandise before December 10th in order to begin selling it. Martha S.: She works making and selling mondongo soup as well as selling nacatamales (Central American tamales). She has her business in her house. She has many orders for nacatamales during the Christmas season, but she doesn't have the capital to purchase the material and for this reason she needs the loan; otherwise she will not be able to cover her clients' requests. Vilma O.: She sells beauty products as well and bed linens. She also needs to purchase items to be ready for the Christmas season. We all need the loan to make our businesses larger and thus earn good incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise

loan.name: Hilarion

texts.es:
Hilarion J. vive en la calle Tocorpatty de la zona de Sensata 79, zona peri urbana de la ciudad de el Alto
Vive junto a su esposa, la cual posee una pequeÃ±a tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio.Tiene tres hijos de 10, 8, 6 aÃ±os, todos varones
Hilarion tiene un taller donde realiza reparaciones a movilidades de transporte pesado, tambiÃ©n se dedica a la venta de neumÃ¡ticos y repuestos para estos.
El crÃ©dito lo destinara en la compra de mercaderÃ­a para su posterior venta en el taller.
Es el segundo crÃ©dito con Impro, la evaluaciÃ³n realizada lo califica para otorgar el crÃ©dito
texts.en:
Hilarion J. lives on Tocorpatty street in the Sensata 79, a suburban zone of the city of El Alto. She lives with her wife, who has a small grocery store in their house. They have three sons, 10, 8 and 6 years old, respectively. Hilarion has a workshop where he performs repairs on heavy transport vehicle. He also works selling original and replacement tires. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise for future sale in his workshop. This is his second loan with Impro; the evaluation performed qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise

loan.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es:
Claudia vive en la Avenida Ramos Gavilan la zona Achachicala en la ciudad de La Paz
Ella vive junto a sus hijos de 4 y 2 aÃ±os, su esposo trabaja en el interior del pais.
Trabaja en la elaboraciÃ³n de pan casero y productos de reposterÃ­a, (masas, queques y otros) los cuales los vende en una zona principal de la ciudad.
Tiene un pequeÃ±o horno que actualmente se encuentra con serios desperfectos y constantes fugas de gas.
Gracias a uno ahorros con los que cuenta y el prÃ©stamo otorgado, adquirirÃ¡ un horno semi nuevo con el cual trabajara en mejores condiciones
Es el primer crÃ©dito con Impro, la evaluaciÃ³n realizada la califica para otorgarle el prÃ©stamo
texts.en:
Claudia lives on Ramos Gavilan Avenue in the Achachicala area of the city of La Paz. She lives together with her children, who are 4 and 2 years old. Her husband works in the interior of the country. Claudia makes homemade bread and other pastries (cakes, doughy pastries and more) which she sells in the main part of the city. She has a small oven which currently has many problems and often has gas leaks. Thanks to some savings she has, along with this loan, she can purchase a better used oven. This will allow Claudia to work in better conditions. This is Claudia's first loan with Impro, who evaluated her situation and decided that she has the qualifications for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase an oven

loan.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Eloy vive en la avenida Hacia El Mar de la zona de Senkata, zona peri urbana de la ciudad de el Alto
Vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica a la artesanÃ­a como tejedora. Tiene tres hijos de 9, 5 y 2 aÃ±os respectivamente.
Posee un taller de cerrajerÃ­a que se encuentra en su domicilio, realiza trabajos en metal consistentes en puertas y ventanas.
El crÃ©dito lo destinara en la compra materiales para su trabajo diario.
Es el primer crÃ©dito con Impro, la evaluaciÃ³n realizada lo califica para otorgar el crÃ©dito
texts.en:
Eloy lives in the Hacia El Mar Avenue in the area of Senkata, a peri urban part of the city of Alto Vivo. He lives there with his wife, who makes handicrafts as a weaver. They have three children who are 9, 5 and 2 years old. Eloy has a metal shop in his home. He does work in metal, such as doors and windows. This loan will be to purchase materials for his work. This is Eloy's first loan with Impro, who evaluated his situation and determined he qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase materials

loan.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La microempresaria Marta Lorena B. tiene 51 aÃ±os de edad es casada con cinco hijos los cuales estudian en nivel primario y secundario. Esta seÃ±ora se dedica desde hace 10 aÃ±os a administrar una pulperÃ­a en donde vende una variedad de productos, tanto carne de res, granos bÃ¡sicos y otros.
Con este negocio ha podido tener ingresos para poder mantener su hogar ya que cuenta con una buena clientela, sin embargo el local no cuenta con suficiente seguridad por lo que ya en una ocasiÃ³n fue victima de robo. Para evitar que vuelva a ser vÃ­ctima de robo debe hacer una inversiÃ³n de instalar verjas de hierro, pero esta inversiÃ³n la descapitalizarÃ­a y no podrÃ­a comprar mas productos.
Por tal motivo necesita el financiamiento para la construcciÃ³n de dos verjas de hierro para las dos ventanas del local y cada una de estas le cuesta US$ 50 dÃ³lares cada una mas la mano de obra valorada en US$ 95 dÃ³lares y ademÃ¡s comprar una vitrina para poder exhibir sus productos la cual le cuesta US$100 dÃ³lares.
texts.en:
Businesswoman Marta Lorena B. is 51 years old and married with five children who attend either primary or secondary school. For the last 10 years Martha has run a small store where she sells a variety of products such as beef, grains etc. The business has provided her with sufficient income to pay her household expenses, and she also has loyal customer base. However, the area now feels unsafe as she was on one occasion the victim of a robbery. So that this doesnâ€™t happen again, she wants to invest in some metal security bars. Such an investment would mean that she wouldnâ€™t have sufficient capital to buy more products for her store. For this reason she needs a loan in order to install security bars on two windows, each of which will cost US$50. On top of that is the cost of installation, about US$95. In addition she wants to buy a glass cabinet in which to display her products, a further cost of US$100.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to buy a display cabinet and installation of security bars on two windows

loan.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es: El seÃ±or Orlando JosÃ© M. Z. tiene la edad de 68 aÃ±os habita en el sector de la borgoÃ±a ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa y hijos, los cuatro hijos de don Orlando le apoyan con el cultivos ya que se encargan de limpiar, sembrar y cuidar las tierras; cada unos de ellos trabaja por cuenta propia. La esposa de don M. trabaja como comerciante para ayudarle con los gastos de casa. El desde hace 40 aÃ±os trabaja con sus cultivos. Don Orlando se siente muy contento ya que ha tenido el apoyo de Afodenic, y ha logrado salir adelante poco a poco con la producciÃ³n. El solicita la cantidad de C$ 10.000.00 cÃ³rdobas para comprar insumos y siempre mantener sus cultivos cuidados para sacarle mejor provecho.
texts.en:
Orlando JosÃ© M. Z. is 68 years old and lives in the BorgoÃ±a sector located in the municipality of Ticuantepe, together with his wife and children. Orlando's four children help him with the crops, cleaning, planting and taking care of the land and all also work on their own. Orlando's wife works as a merchant to help him with the household expenses. He has been working with his crops for 40 years. Orlando is very content that he has had the support of Afodenic, and has managed to get ahead little by little with his production. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 CÃ³rdobas to purchase materials and maintain his crops to provide him with a better harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of incesticide and fertilizer to care for his crops

loan.name: Sigamos Adelante Group

texts.es:
hola nosotros somos el grupo Sigamos Adelante, somos un grupo bien unido, tenemos muchos aÃ±os de conocernos, siempre hemos trabajado juntos, somos vecinos y tenemos mucho tiempo de concernos, todos decidimos poner nuestros propios negocios ya que en nuestro pais es dificil conseguir trabajo y la unica manera de generar ingresos para nuestros hogares es teniendo nuestro propio negocio, todos estamos muy felices ya que nos va muy bien pero como en todo negocio todo tiene sus altos y bajos, en estos momentos necesitamos un credito para sacar adelante nuestros negocios. nuestras actividades son las siguientes: Herlinda M.: soy la coordinadora del grupo mi actividad principal es la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo una pulperia la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia ISIS KARINA, soy casada y madre de 6 hijos, tengo la ayuda de mi esposo para sacar adelante nuestro hogar, entre ambos logramos cubrir los gastos familiares. Digna H.: ella es comerciante individual, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, actividad que realiza de manera ambulante en diferentes comunidades y caserios, ella es casada y es madre de 5 hijos, ella tiene la ayuda de su esposo el cual se dedica a la agricultura y ganaderia, entre los dos cubren con los gastos del hogar. Miguel B.: el se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo y de res, en estos momentos esta interesado en vender pollos tambien, esta venta la hace por las maÃ±anas ya que en la tarde se dedica a la agricultura. Maria Emelia M.: ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene su tienda en la casa de habitacion, tambien ella vende recargas de llamadas para una empresa de telefonia movil, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos, el esposo de ella se dedica a la agricultura y ambos se audan para sacar adelante su hogar. Norma N.: ella se dedica a vender carne de pollo, res y cerdo, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, asi no descuida a sus hijos, ella tiene 3 hijos, mi esposo me ayuda a vender mis carnes en diferentes caserios y comunidades cercanas a nuestro hogar,.
todos necesitamos del credito para salir adelante, queremos y deseamos superarnos.
texts.en:
Hello. We are the â€œSigamos Adelanteâ€ (â€œLet's Move Forward!â€) group. We are a very close group of neighbors and have known each other and worked together for many years. Because it is difficult to find work in our country and the only way to generate income is to be entrepreneurial, we decided to start our own businesses. We are all very happy and everything is going well, but every business has its ups and downs. So, we currently need a loan to continue to develop our businesses. Our activities are the following: Herlinda M.: I am the coordinator of the group. My primary activity is the sale of common household items. I have a small general store called â€œIsis Karina's Shop.â€ I am a married mother of six children. My husband helps maintain our home, and between the two of us we successfully cover our household expenses. Digna H.: Digna is an independent shopkeeper. She travels to different towns and villages to sell new clothes. She is married and the mother of five children. Digna is assisted by her husband, a farmer and cattle rancher. Together, they cover their household expenses. Miguel B.: Miguel sells pork and beef. Currently, he is interested in selling chickens as well. Because he spends his afternoons farming, he is only able to sell meat in the mornings. Maria Emelia M.: Maria sells common household items from a shop in her home. She also sells prepaid phone cards for a mobile telephone company. Maria is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer and they work together to improve their home. Norma N.: Norma sells chicken, beef, and pork. Her business is located in her home so that she can take care of her three children. Her husband helps sell the meat in several nearby communities. We all need this loan to get ahead. We truly want to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase merchandise.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Uriel Antonio

texts.es: El seÃ±or Uriel Antonio M. tiene la edad de 33 aÃ±os, habita en la ConcepciÃ³n junto a su esposa y hijos, uno de ellos trabaja como jardinero para ayudarle con los gastos al igual que la esposa trabaja como responsable de mantenimiento, para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar , Don Uriel desde hace 15 aÃ±os trabaja como vendedor de frutas en los departamentos y la mayor dificultad que ha tenido es la falta de financiamiento , los sueÃ±os de Ã©l es llegar a tener una pulperÃ­a y a la ves vender sus frutas para mejorar las condiciones de su familia .Este seÃ±or solicita la cantidad de C$ 12,000.00 cÃ³rdobas para incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Uriel Antonio M. is 33 years old, lives in the town of Concepcion together with his wife and children. One of them works as a gardener to help with the expenses and his wife works in household maintenance. Uriel has been working as a fruit vendor for the past 15 years and the greatest difficulty he has faced is the lack of financing. His dreams are to have grocery store and to also sell his fruits to improve his family's living conditions. He requests a loan amounting to C@12,000 cordobas, which he will use to expand his business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase fruit and vegetables.

loan.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is a member of the Santa Rita Village Bank. Ninfa is 40 years old and married with eight children. Ninfa sells traditional Peruvian food like â€œpuca picanteâ€ and other dishes in a marketplace near Ayacuchoâ€™s stadium on the weekends. During the week, Ninfa sells food from a wheeled cart. Ninfa needs a loan of 800 soles to buy rice, oil, and pasta. Ninfa dreams of improving her home, of owning her own home, and that her children will finish school.
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow
Ninfa es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita. Ninfa es casada, tiene 40 aÃ±os y 8 hijos, Ninfa venD. comida tÃ­pica como puca picante entre otros platos, en una feria que se ubica cerca al estadio D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, actividad que realiza los sÃ¡bados y domingos. AdemÃ¡s Ninfa los dÃ­as D. semana venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria con la ayuda D. un triciclo. Ninfa necesita un prÃ©stamo D. 800 soles dinero que serÃ¡ invertido en la compra D. arroz, aceite, fideo. Ninfa sueÃ±a con mejorar su casa, tener una casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loan.use: To buy rice, oil and pasta to prepare and sell food.

loan.name: Balvina

texts.en:
Balvina is a member of the Santa Rita Village Bank. Balvina is married and has seven children. She is 43 years old. She sells fruit from a mobile cart near the Magdalena market. She works from 8am to 7pm each day with the help of her children. Balvina needs a loan of 800 soles to buy pineapples, bananas, papayas, and peaches. Balvinaâ€™s dreams are to build a home from bricks and cement, to proviD. a good education for her children, and to expand her business.
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow
Balvina es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita. Balvina es casada, tiene 43 aÃ±os y 7 hijos, Balvina venD. frutas D. manera ambulatoria cerca del mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza desD. las 8 D. la maÃ±ana hasta las 7 D. la noche con la ayuda D. sus hijos. Balvina necesita un prÃ©stamo D. 800 soles dinero que serÃ¡ invertido en la compra D. piÃ±a, plÃ¡tano, papaya, durazno. Los sueÃ±os D. Balvina son construir su casa con material noble, brindar una buena educaciÃ³n a sus hijos y hacer crecer su negocio.

loan.use: To buy pineapples, bananas, papayas, and peaches to sell

loan.name: Karina

texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Santa Rita Village Bank. Karina is 23 years old and lives with her partner; she is currently pregnant with their first child. Karina has a stand in the April 12th Market in the city of Ayacucho, where she and her partner sell a variety of clothing items for adults. The couple buys their wares in the city of Lima, a 9-hour bus ride from Ayacucho. Karina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy more menâ€™s t-shirts. Karina dreams of having her own t-shirt business with printed logos some day. She also dreams of buying a piece of land, getting married, and living a happy life.
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita. Karina es conviviente, tiene 23 aÃ±os y esta embarazada de su primer hijo, Karina tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada para adultos, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo, la mercaderÃ­a lo adquieren en la ciudad de Lima. Karina necesita un prÃ©stamo de 1000 soles dinero que serÃ¡ invertido en la compra de polos para varones. Karina sueÃ±a con tener una fabrica de polos, estampados, adquirir un terreno, casarse y vivir feliz.

loan.use: To buy men's t-shirts to sell in Ayacucho

loan.name: Julian

texts.en:
Julian is a member of the Santa Rita Village Bank. He is 40 years old, single, and lives with his parents. Julian is an artist; he makes beautiful altarpieces and wooden boxes with scenes of local customs (like Carnaval, Holy Week, and â€œherranza,â€ a traditional Peruvian animal-marking ceremony). Julian and his brothers make their crafts at home, then sell their wares in the cities of Lima and Cuzco. Julian needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy plaster, flour, and paint. Julian dreams of having his own handicraft company, of exporting his work, and of working in agriculture.
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow
JuliÃ¡n es socio del Banco Comunal Santa Rita. JuliÃ¡n es soltero y tiene 40 aÃ±os, vive con su padres, JuliÃ¡n es artesano, realiza bellos retablos, Cajones D. madera en donD. plasma las costumbres D. L. regiÃ³n, como herranza, carnavales, L. semana santa, actividad que realiza en su casa con L. ayuda D. sus hermanos, sus ventas lo realiza en L. ciudad D. Lima y Cuzco. Julian necesita un prÃ©stamo D. 1000 soles dinero que serÃ¡ invertido en L. compra D. yeso, harina y pinturas. Julian sueÃ±a con tener una empresa D. artesanÃ­a, productos D. exportaciÃ³n y dedicarse tambiÃ©n a L. agricultura.

loan.use: Buy plaster, flour and paint for his handicraft business

loan.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a member of the Santa Rita Village Bank. Diana is 21 years old and single. She sells a variety of adult and childrenâ€™s clothing in a rented stall at the April 12th Market. She works every day from 7am to 7pm. Diana needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy t-shirts and pants. Dianaâ€™s dreams are to sell her wares in bulk and to have her own workshop to produce clothing.
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow
Diana es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita. Diana es soltera y tiene 21 aÃ±os, Diana vende ropa en un puesto alquilado del mercado 12 de abril, en donde vende ropa variada para niÃ±os, adultos, actividad que realiza todos los dÃ­as desde las 7 de la maÃ±ana hasta las 7 de la noche. Diana necesita un prÃ©stamo de 1000 soles dinero que serÃ¡ invertido en la compra de polos pantalones. Los sueÃ±os de Diana son ser mayorista, tener un taller de producciÃ³n de prendas de vestir.

loan.use: Buy t-shirts and pants to sell in the market.

loan.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Santa Rita Village Bank. Maria is 42 years old and married with six children. She sells a variety of fruits from a mobile cart every day on Libertad Street in the city of Ayacucho. Her husband owns a locksmith shop, which he runs from their home. Maria needs a loan of 600 soles to buy apples and bananas. Maria dreams of improving and expanding her business, of selling fruit in bulk, and of improving her home.
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita. Maria es casada, tiene 42 aÃ±os y 6 hijos, Maria vende frutas variadas, actividad que realiza todos los dÃ­as de manera ambulatoria en la calle libertad, AdemÃ¡s su esposo tiene un taller de cerrajerÃ­a en su casa. Maria necesita un prÃ©stamo de 600 soles dinero que serÃ¡ invertido en la compra de manzanas, plÃ¡tanos. Maria sueÃ±a con mejorar su negocio, ampliar su negocio y ser mayorista, mejorar su casa.

loan.use: Buy apples and bananas to sell from a mobile cart

loan.name: Leoncia Maria

texts.en:
Leoncia is a member of the Qory Qaytu Village Bank. Qory Qaytu means â€œthread of goldâ€ in Quechua. She is 50 years old and widowed with six children, three of whom still live with her.

Leoncia sells dry goods (sugar, flour, rice) in bulk and individually in the Peruvian jungle. She buys the items in Ayacuchoâ€™s Nery Market and travels once a week to the jungle, where she buys pineapples and bananas to bring back to Ayacucho to sell. She has been in this line of work for the past ten years. It gets tiring sometimes, she says, since some weeks she makes as many as three trips back and forth.

Leoncia is requesting a loan of 900 soles to buy more dry goods to take to the jungle and sell. Her goal for the future is to save her money so that she can take care of herself as she gets older.

loan.use: Buy dry goods (flour, rice, sugar) to sell in the jungle

loan.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is a member of the Qory Qaytu Village Bank. Qory Qaytu means â€œthread of goldâ€ in Quechua. Celia is 25 and lives with her husband and their son. Celia has a dry goods store in Ayacucho, which she has run for the past three years.

Celia is requesting a loan of 900 soles to buy a mix of different dry goods, like flour, sugar, and rice. Celia says that she has been able to grow her business bit by bit thanks to previous loans from FINCA. Her goal for the future is to make some home improvements.

loan.use: Buy dry goods (flour, sugar, and rice) to sell in the market

loan.name: Roberto

texts.es: El seÃ±or Roberto es una persona muy trabajadora tiene su propio negocio de soldadura llamado "Servicios M." el esta solicitando este credito para realizar unos pagos a proveedores y para compra de material para que su negocio siga creciendo y darles a sus clientes mejor calidad en el trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto M. is a very hard-working person who has his own welding business called â€œServicios M..â€ He is requesting this loan in order to pay his suppliers and purchase materials so that his business can continue to grow and he can offer his customers better work quality.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Pay suppliers and purchase materials

loan.name: Obed

texts.es: E l seÃ±or Obed es un muchacho joven pero que conoce de responsabilidades y que hay que trabajar para lograr las metas que nos propongamos.El tiene una imprenta y esta solicitando el credito para realizar unos pagos a proveedores que tiene pendientes, y desea seguir creciendo en su negocio que empieza a dar frutos.
texts.en:
Mr. Obed R. is a young man who nevertheless knows about responsibility, and knows that we must work in order to achieve the goals that we set for ourselves. He has his own printing works, and he is requesting this loan in order to make payments that are outstanding to his suppliers. He hopes that his business, which is now starting to be fruitful, will keep growing.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Pay suppliers

loan.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Mrs. Elsie S., 25 years of age, is a member of Mangrove 2 Center, Danao Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is married to Rogelio and blessed with 3 kids. She was attracted to Paglaumâ€™s various programs and services and joined in April 2008.

Prior to joining PMPC, she had a fish business, and she believes that the Cooperative can be of help to her. She aspires to have additional capital. The first loan she received made her business run well and the returns prompted her to purchase a lot to support her husbandâ€™s small â€œpayawâ€ (fish attractor cage).

Elsie did not rest comfortably with the buy and sell â€œbanierasâ€ (a large deep set basin) of fish. With Rogelio's â€œpayawâ€, this means an extra living. She applied for another loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to bear the capital of â€œpayawâ€.

Her dream is to buy a second-hand pump boat that will surely expand their little business and with that they have high hopes of educating all their children.

loan.use: to buy more fishing accessories and use as capital for her husband's "payaw"

loan.name: Sokheang

texts.en: Mrs. Sokheang V. is 35 years old and now lives in Ta Sean village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Seim V., are fruit sellers. Since this business is going well, they want to expand their business; to this end, Mrs. Sokheang V. decided to ask for a loan to buy a greater variety of fruit in their business. She hopes thereby to expand her customer base and thus increase her income and improve the life of her and her family. She has six children: one is a construction worker; one helps with the business; three are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loan.use: To buy a greater variety of fruit for their business

loan.name: Bobby

texts.en:
Mrs. Bobby Potutan A., 42 years of age and a widow, lives in Looc Mansabay, Bajo, Lopez Jaena. With their simple abode near the seashore, she works hard to support her family with buying and selling fish and other seafood. Her son comes with her to help with bags and bundles of vegetables for added income.

A pail of fish in one hand and a pail of seafood in the other makes a daily earning of PHP 450. She sells around the little "barangay" of Tipan and even reaches to nearby town of Aloran. Close family ties are what motivates her to survive and be strong for her children as their father and mother in one.

She desires to send all her children to school with Paglaum MPC as her financing partner.

loan.use: To purchase additional stock of fish and vegetables

location.town: Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occidental

loan.name: Kimhoin

texts.en: Mrs. Kimhoin S. is 29 years old and now lives in Khnol Dambang village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a pig breeder. Her business is currently going well, and she would like to expand it so she is seeking a loan to buy more piglets and pig food, thereby increasing her income and improving her living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Sat Soeurn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Mrs. Kimhoin S. has two children who are attending the local school.

loan.use: To buy more piglets and pig food

loan.name: Tem

texts.en: Mrs. Tem C. is 41 years old and makes a living growing rice and vegetables such as water-lilies and cabbages to sell. She is a mother of five children; three are in school and two are fisherman. Her husband, Mr. On Louy, 47, is a local fisherman who fishes around Tunle Sap Lake for fish to sell and to eat. Tem is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 to purchase furniture for decorating her house. The family lives in Kotlokkroam Commune in Siem Reap Province.

loan.use: To purchase furniture for her house

loan.name: Mrs. Nget Soun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank consists of twenty-two members and is located in Roka village in Kandal Province, and they plan to use the loan proceeds for different purposes. Mrs. Nget S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a Khmer noodle seller. She has been earning progressively less income to support her household, and she now lives in poor conditions and so wants to start a new business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy tables, chairs, plates and so on to start a rice soup business. She is a 42-year-old widow with four children who are all attending the local school.

This is a group loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. One member has end-of-term loans and the rest of have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMKâ€™s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodiaâ€™s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMKâ€™s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To buy tables, chairs, plates and supplies to start a rice soup business
